Job_Title: Media Relations Executive, Motion: For Impact
Job_Descriptions: Overall Objectives: To work with Motion's Communications Lead to develop and execute communications strategies for press and media To promote and ensure consistency and strength of Motion's branding and reputation Core Responsibilities: Build on Motion's messaging house and identify industry trends and opportunities to proactively pitch persuasive brand stories to target media Develop sharp and effective press kits, fact sheets and releases for distribution to target media for events and projects Develop talking points and coach spokespersons for media interviews Manage day-to-day media enquiries and coordinate media availability Consolidate media coverage and clippings on monthly basis Identify and advise on best tools and strategies for optimal engagement of media campaigns (print and digital) Work closely with Communications Lead to ensure accurate and consistent use of media materials and brand assets Cultivate strong relationships with print, broadcast and digital media partners Monitor and evaluate reach of media compaigns across media platforms against business objectives Report on media coverage, performance and trends updates in weekly progress meetings Develop monthly and/or quarterly coverage and performance reports

What the role is Information Security Officer, Senior Manager Work Type: Contract Position At Sport Singapore, we aspire to transform the nation through an active lifestyle designed around innovative, fun and meaningful sporting experiences. Sport has the unique ability to bring people together through play, regardless of age, gender, race, ability or social status. It imparts life values, nurtures character and builds resilience. It inspires and evokes the Singapore spirit through shared experiences and strengthens our national identity. We help Singaporeans Live Better Through Sport. Sport Singapore is constantly on the lookout for individuals who are passionate about what they do. Anchored in our values of Passion for Sport, Strength through Teamwork and Care for People, we believe in working and playing, not just as a team, but as a family. Job Responsibilities You will be reporting to the Agency Chief Information Security Officer (CISO), Performance Technology. In this role, you will be part of the team to play a critical role for ensuring a consistent and adequate level of information systems security within SportSG. You will be working closely with Agency CISO to promote best practices and raise organisational security posture in compliance with the agency’s Information Security requirements and prevailing ICT policies or standards alignment with Whole of Government (WOG). In addition, you will be part of the team to Supporting and contributing role for any initiative from ICT and Digitalisation Steering Committees (IDSC), and Data Governance working committee. Representative member of the Change Management Board (CAB) Support ICT risk assessments (System, vendors, infrastructure, and application) Maintain ICT policies, frameworks, and standards and to ensure SportSG ICT security posture and security documentation, in compliance to the stipulated Government policies and regulations. Validate security operational processes such as review of security gaps in logical access review, manual security log review, patch management, asset management. etc) Participate in project lifecycle by providing security advisory (i.e. definition of technical solutions to specific security requirements, identifying specific security implications and validate functional specifications and technical architecture) Collaborate with Project Managers in preparing work papers to engage 3rd party vendors for Vulnerability Assessment and Penetration Testing (VAPT) and for IT Audits. Conduct periodic security awareness to 3rd party vendor. Identify risk gaps and propose treatment actions to reduce residual risk to acceptable level based on SportSG risk appetite. Provide inputs towards continual improvement work on cyber and data security management and prepare risk reporting to management. As a Security incident response officer (SIRO) role to coordinate, investigate and escalate on any suspected or confirmed security incidents. Review Incident Management Plan to refine and implement continuous improvement. Other duties as directed. What you will be working on What we are looking for Job Requirements We are looking for self-motivated individuals who value integrity, teamwork and take pride in going the extra mile to provide excellent service to stakeholders and the community. This individual should be a sport advocate through living an active lifestyle and staying active. In addition, an ideal candidate should possess the following; Background in Information Security Management, Computer Science, Information Systems, Information/Infocomm Technology, Computer or related discipline At least 5 years of relevant working experience Experience and skills on ISACA CISA or CISSP equivalent is desired Knowledge in Vulnerability and compliance tools (such as Nessus, Webinspect, etc) Knowledge of IM8 is preferred Strong analytical, conceptualization and problem-solving skills Motivated by innovation to achieve business goals and customer satisfaction Excellent written, verbal communication, presentation and negotiation skills The level of offer will commensurate with applicants’ experience and track records. Successful candidates will be offered a 2/3-year' contract in the first instance.

What the role is Network Infrastructure Engineer, Performance Technology Work Type: Contract / Full time Position At Sport Singapore, we aspire to transform the nation through an active lifestyle designed around innovative, fun and meaningful sporting experiences. Sport has the unique ability to bring people together through play, regardless of age, gender, race, ability or social status. It imparts life values, nurtures character and builds resilience. It inspires and evokes the Singapore spirit through shared experiences and strengthens our national identity. We help Singaporeans Live Better Through Sport. Sport Singapore is constantly on the lookout for individuals who are passionate about what they do. Anchored in our values of Passion for Sport, Strength through Teamwork and Care for People, we believe in working and playing, not just as a team, but as a family. Job Responsibilities Manage end-to-end network service(s) and work with various agencies & departments on contractual matters, SLA and operational issues. Engineer is expected to be technical strong in various network technology used for LAN, WAN, VPN, Internet routing, etc. Work with vendors on the delivery of services for government-wide network infrastructure and services, ensuring efficient operations management, compliance to policies and standards. Work with various parties to participate in matters relating to finance budgeting, contract management, procurement, asset management and audit of government-wide network infrastructure and services. Manage the delivery of services by reviewing the technical setup and change requests against defined policies and standards, while liaising with architects, consultants and agency stakeholder(s) as required, and to manage expectations. Engage stakeholders, through presentations or proposal, to provide key updates such as major incidents, enhancements, upcoming changes, etc. May participate in the development of technical standards, roadmap and policies for the use of government-wide network infrastructure systems and services. What you will be working on What we are looking for Job Requirements At least 3 to 6 years of relevant IT experience in deploying or/and operating network infrastructure and services. Strong track record and experience in contract and vendor management. Good knowledge and experience in network infrastructure and technologies, such as LAN, WAN and software-defined networking (SDN). Keen to learn, pro-active, dynamic and with good analytical/conceptual thinking. Able to work independently and a good team player. Good written and verbal communication, able to present and communicate effectively with non-technical audience and senior management. User-oriented with strong interpersonal skills. Candidates who possess industry certifications such as Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL), COMIT, CITPM, PMP and/or CCNA preferred. Familiar in Government ICT environment. The level of offer will commensurate with applicants’ experience and track records. Successful candidates will be offered a 2-years' fixed term contract in the first instance

Fitch Solutions provides data, research and analytics that help clients excel at managing their credit risk, offer deep insight into the debt investment market, and provide comprehensive intelligence about the macroeconomic environment. All available on our platform, Fitch Connect, designed and built using our credit, macro and industry expertise to help you make more informed decisions. Role: Senior Country Risk Analyst – Asia Location: Singapore This is an opportunity to join the Asia Country Risk team at the top-ranked independent research provider, Fitch Solutions. You will be contributing to our market intelligence service, providing analytical research for senior decision makers in banks, consultancies, multinational corporations, investment funds and government agencies. Role Work as part of the Asia Country Risk team, providing regular economic, political risk and financial market analysis. Act as analytical lead for a portfolio of major economies, taking full ownership of all forecasts and historical data. Write research notes on a daily basis, as well as contributing to monthly and quarterly analysis, producing both country-specific and thematic regional research including: economic growth, fiscal & monetary policy, trade, debt dynamics, political risk, financial markets and demographics. Work on maintaining and further developing proprietary data sets that add analytical value. Work with sales to represent the team and deliver key views and forecasts in a concise and articulate manner during client engagements as well as at industry events. Be a brand ambassador for our research and company. Be commercially minded and understand how research and data is used by our clients. Help mentor and guide more junior analysts on the team through training, editing and discussion of forecasts and views. Skills Relevant experience in economic analysis required, ideally with a focus on Asia, but we would consider a strong candidate who has been focused on a different region. Ability to manage own time and adhere to publication deadlines. Strong public speaker. Strong writing skills, with experience conveying complex views in a succinct and straightforward manner. Ability to work with and analyze large data sets and forecast across key macroeconomic indicators. Familiarity analysing connections between political and macroeconomic risk. Fluent spoken and written English, other languages beneficial. Strong team-working and communication skills, but also able to work independently. Qualifications BA/MA/MSc/PhD in economics or a closely related field. Relevant background working as a macroeconomic/sovereign risk analyst required, with experience in analysis, data management and forecasting. #LI-TD1 #LI-Solutions Fitch Group is a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Wholly owned by the Hearst Corporation, we are comprised of three main businesses: Fitch Ratings | Fitch Solutions | Fitch Learning. Fitch is committed to providing global securities markets with objective, timely, independent and forward-looking credit opinions. To protect Fitch’s credibility and reputation, our employees must take every precaution to avoid conflicts of interests or any appearance of a conflict of interest. Should you be successful in the recruitment process at Fitch Ratings you will be asked to declare any securities holdings and other potential conflicts prior to commencing employment. If you, or your immediate family, have any holdings that may conflict with your work responsibilities, you may be asked to divest yourself of them before beginning work. Fitch is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

What the role is The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) is Singapore’s central bank and integrated financial regulator. As central bank, MAS promotes sustained, non-inflationary economic growth through the conduct of monetary policy and close macroeconomic surveillance and analysis. It manages Singapore’s exchange rate, official foreign reserves, and liquidity in the banking sector. As an integrated financial supervisor, MAS fosters a sound financial services sector through its prudential oversight of all financial institutions in Singapore – banks, insurers, capital market intermediaries, financial advisors, and stock exchanges. It is also responsible for well-functioning financial markets, sound conduct, and investor education. MAS also works with the financial industry to promote Singapore as a dynamic international financial centre. It facilitates the development of infrastructure, adoption of technology, and upgrading of skills in the financial industry. Join us now, if you have a genuine interest in making an impact to help shape Singapore’s economic and financial landscape. What you will be working on The External Fund Management (EFM) Division manages the portion of MAS’ foreign reserves that is outsourced to external fund managers. You will join a team that plays an active part in all aspects of the EFM process, including manager due diligence, selection, performance and ESG evaluation, implementation and account management, as well as contribute to the larger reserve management objectives. The EFM process is dynamic and multi-faceted. You will engage and interact with a diverse range of EFMs across multiple asset classes. You will develop core portfolio management competencies and acquire expertise in reserve management as well as in related areas in external fora. What we are looking for Relevant experience is preferred. High levels of drive, commitment, initiative, integrity and good team ethic. Sound knowledge of, and a passion for, investment management. Interest in sustainability / ESG Project management and negotiation skills with a keen eye for details. Ability to work with different parties within and outside the organisation. Applicants should be Singapore citizens. You will be working in a fast-paced environment that would require the ability to manage multiple priorities and needs of stakeholders, as well as the agility to respond to changes and developments. As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment. All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Job_Title: Assistant Manager to Senior Manager, Entertainment
Job_Descriptions: What the role is Purpose of Job: The Entertainment team is responsible for developing strategies and driving initiatives to support the growth of the entertainment and events sector, ensuring the objectives and outcomes tie in with STB’s aim of promoting economic growth through the tourism sector. Areas which the team currently focuses on includes family entertainment, music festivals, special interest (e.g. esports and popular culture) and the nightlife economy. This includes: Attracting best-in-class/premium branded content events with international appeal and a strong following Growing and refreshing home-grown events to be signature events that will drive visitation Supporting new event genres and formats that are in line with global trends Improving the overall operating environment for the nightlife and leisure events sector What you will be working on Main Responsibilities: The incoming officer will work closely with industry players and stakeholders (public and private sector) to identify, facilitate and anchor a pipeline of international branded as well as home-grown entertainment events/products that would strengthen Singapore’s position as a leading events & entertainment destination in Asia. Daily work will likely include evaluating event proposals and managing grant applications, cultivating strategic partnerships with branded content owners, working together with agencies/ministries to manage infrastructure matters and regulatory issues, as well as engaging key trade associations to support overall industry development initiatives. Due to the long drawn effects of COVID, the Entertainment team is also helping the entertainment industry to pivot and adapt to the new normal as part of our daily work. The Entertainment team has recently updated the leisure events strategy that was endorsed by MTI PS in Sep 2021, and is the fund owner for LEF. The incoming officer will work closely with Incentive Policy (IP), and other line units within Experience Development Group (EDG) which utilise LEF to support their projects and develop the fund parameters of LEF4 to better support the leisure events sector and build industry capabilities to ensure a steady pipeline of high quality events which will enhance Singapore's destination appeal and continue to be future-ready. Other coordination work across line units within EDG in relation to leisure events reporting will also be required. What we are looking for 2-5 years of working experience in a business development or account servicing role Integrity, Passion, Teamwork, Analytical thinking, Financial savvy, Commercial savvy, Adaptability Keen interest in the tourism, entertainment and events industry Strong written, presentation, communication skills (minimally in English) Good business acumen, project management, stakeholder management and interpersonal skills Proficiency in MS Office - Excel, Word & Powerpoint An added advantage for candidates with Business Acumen, Leadership, Basic marketing knowledge, basic financial, legal and contractual knowledge, Relevant industry experience/knowledge including policy work and Interest in music, special interest events Ability to thrive in a dynamic environment

Hiring_Company: Ministry of Sustainability and the Environment
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Water and Food Policy Division (WFPD) works closely with the PUB, Singapore’s National Water Agency and the Singapore Food Agency to formulate, review and implement a broad range of policies and strategies to ensure supply of water and safe food for Singapore. The policy areas under WFPD include: the provision of a reliable and high quality water supply; flood risk management and drainage planning; regulating water sector performance and demand management; securing a supply of safe food for Singapore; and enhancing food safety. Senior Assistant Director (Food Safety) Singapore’s food security is ensured through a basket of strategies. First, we import from a well diversified network of overseas food sources. Second, we aim to raise our local production through the “30 by 30” goal – for our agri-food sector to produce 30% of our nutritional needs by 2030, up from less than 10% today. Third, we facilitate our local agri-food companies in expanding overseas so they can export back to Singapore. We also stockpile essential food items such as rice. In the area of food safety, SFA’s food safety regimes will also be augmented, with the roll-out of the Safety Assurance for Food Establishments (SAFE) framework and Supply of Safe Food Bill (SSF Bill) to pull together the food safety legislations residing in 7 different Acts currently. You will lead a dynamic team that contributes to the strategic objectives of enhancing food safety. You will contribute to the wider sustainability agenda through your development of policies and joint programmes that intersect with other policy areas within the MSE family and with the wider Public Service. What you will be working on Your key responsibilities include: Manage the food safety team in WFPD to ensure that it supports the overall objectives of the Division, the Ministry and the Public Service. Work with partner agencies to formulate and review strategies, policies and legislation/regulations to strengthen Singapore’s food safety regime. Work with communications teams to sharpen public communications plans and messages relating to food safety issues. Engage a wide variety of stakeholders – such as associations/industry players, academics and the public – to push the frontiers of food safety. Perform research and analysis on food safety policies, both domestic and international. What we are looking for Strong analytical and numerical skills Good verbal and written communication skills Team player with strong inter-personal skills Ability to apply systems thinking

What the role is Engineer (Digital Fabrication & Additive Manufacturing Centre) What you will be working on Contribute as an active member to support the core interests and development plans of DFAMC. Apply industry-leading technologies and good engineering practices in Additive Manufacturing (AM) to undertake and drive projects and training. Work closely with team members, stakeholders, industry partners, relevant associations and agencies to secure project funding, and to deliver programmes related to training, outreach, competition and other core centre initiatives and developments. Plan, lead, collaborate, manage and develop projects with industry partners. Demonstrate good problem-solving, evaluative and judgment skills based on sound analysis and application of technical knowledge and skills through gained experience. Work collaboratively with team lead and members as a functional team for R&D work, contribute to operational and strategic decision making, and establish quality and process improvement protocols. What we are looking for Qualification in suitable disciplines including Engineering and Additive Manufacturing. At least 5 years of relevant working experience in Additive Manufacturing in relevant industries. Competent in the following areas: a) Good working knowledge in AM technologies and the use of a variety of 3D printers, scanners and CAD software. b) Knowledgeable in material and chemical safety, handling, and processing. Proven track record in project management and development. Possess passion and genuine interest in AM, and in sharing of knowledge. Possess good command of English Language, strong communication and interpersonal skills.

Compliance with the relevant codes and guidelines ensures that media content is in line with community standards and expectations, while helping consumers make informed choices and protecting the young from unsuitable content. Job_Title: AVP, Test Automation Lead, Consumer Banking Group (WD29565)
Job_Descriptions: Business Function As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business - they were made just right for you. Responsbilities Design, develop, execute and maintain test automation assets for our Android, iOS applications and micro services Contribute towards continuous improvement and enhancementof Automation Frameworks Mentor the team in case of any blockers (technical or functional) while scripting /execution Maintain Regression Suite and facilitate execution on demand with quick turn around time Develop jobs to run automation tests via Jenkins and facilitate CI/CD Implementation Run profiling tests as part of the pipeline Advocate the quality culture in cross-functional teams and make sure that the best practices are followed. Design, develop, execute and maintain test cases, for our Android and iOS applications and REST API Establish testing as an integral part of the development process within cross-functional teams Develop maintainable automated checks in collaboration with our development teams Proactively suggest improvements in testing tools for better test coverage Find and report bugs and follow up on their resolution Use exploratory testing techniques to discover and prevent issues Assess and bring improvements to the quality of our applications and services Requirements Experience in leading complex large-scale testing projects Minimum of 5 years' experience in Mobile Automation testing. 8+ years of relevant QA technical experience. Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, test tools, and processes Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process Experience with performance and/or security testing is a plus Banking experience is preferred Experience in API testing and automation frameworks. You should know how to work with Jira, TestRail, Jenkins, Docker, etc. Solid coding background in Java, Objective-C, JavaScript or similar . Experience with at the following technologies: Jbehave, Cucumber, Appium, Selenium , XCode UI Automation, Espresso, (mobile testing tools and frameworks). Experience with basic UNIX commands and working knowledge on LINUX flavor. Hands-on experience tool like and SOAP UI, REST API. You should have working knowledge on Bit Bucket etc. (Anything apart from BitBucket are good to have). You should know how to view quality holistically and ensure the highest software quality Bachelor's or Master's degree Tech Skill Sets At least 5 years of working experience(s) preferably Mobile Banking solutions Strong knowledge on Appium , Selenium , JUNIT. Strong coding knowledge in Java , Objective-C, JavaScript or similar. Good experience in developing complex SQL queries. Knowledge of SOAP UI and web service testing is a plus. Expertise in Agile tools like Jira , Zephyr . Strong knowledge on Jira addons like 'Better Excel Exporter for Jira', 'Adaptavist ScriptRunner for JIRA', 'JSU - Suite Utilities for Jira etc'. Knowledge of basic UNIX Commands and ability to work with Linux flavor. GIT commands and their usage. Tech Skills Preferred Network De-Bugging and Test Automation Tools Java, SQL, UNIX. Skills (Non-Technical) Must have resilience and the ability to work well under pressure Should be hard working and ready to put extra efforts as per project need Strong working knowledge of SDLC and STLC practices and procedures. Should be able a quick learner and adapt to change. Ability to handle multiple concurrent activities and projects Ability to work along with team distributed across locations Strong sense of ownership for assigned projects Good Analytical and problem-solving skills Able to articulate well on solution(s) Able to work as a team Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

What the role is We are seeking an immersive media (Augmented Reality, Virtual Reality, Mixed Reality) Engineer/Senior Engineer to build cutting edge solutions. If you are driven, love playing with the latest technology, comfortable juggling multiple assignments, prefer collaborative environments, thrive on challenge, and continually strive to be an expert in your field, then you are who we have in mind. What you will be working on Working in a small project-oriented development team to create immersive media (augmented, virtual and mixed reality) experiences and solutions for training, industry and research projects. Collaborating with other developers to evaluate project needs. Implementing user interfaces based on mockups and storyboards. Crafting intuitive user interactions for both novice and experienced users. Writing well-documented, reusable code in C++, C#, Python or other languages as necessary. Diagnosing, documenting, and fixing bugs reported by testers and users. Participating in project planning and team code reviews. Keeping up with the latest trends and advancements in immersive media. Supervising student projects and internships. What we are looking for Qualification in Computer Engineering, Computer Science Information Technology, Game Design or related fields. 1-5 years of experience in developing immersive media solutions. Proficient knowledge of code in C++, C#, Python or other programming languages. Excellent knowledge of Unity3D and/or Unreal software. Experience with scripting, textures, animation, GUI styles, user session management, optimizing memory and space usage. Knowledge of game physics and simulation. Knowledge of designing for AR/VR/MR. Familiarity with SDKs such as ARCore, ARKit, ARFoundation, Vuforia, Wikitude, OpenVR, SteamVR, VRTK and Oculus is an added advantage. Familiarity with hardware, machine vision and AI is an added advantage. Knowledge of 3D development pipeline. Basic knowledge of 3D software e.g. Maya, 3DS Max, Blender. Critical thinker and problem-solving skills. Team player with good communication skills. Good time-management skills.

What the role is The successful candidate shall lead or be part of a multi-disciplinary research team that will perform application research and design to bring concepts to commercialization. The candidate should have a passion for product/process design, be a hands-on person, and a good team player. The candidate will also be expected to design and develop battery management systems for electric-powered equipment or devices such as forklifts, and EVs as well as energy storage system applications. What you will be working on Undertake power electronics and/or microcontroller circuit design, PCB routing. Work with PCB fabrication and assembly vendors. Develop firmware and algorithm for the battery management system. Conduct system testing and perform data analysis. Work with industry collaborators. What we are looking for Tertiary qualification in Electronic Engineering, Computer Engineering or equivalent. Experience in power electronic circuits and embedded systems at least 5 years for senior Engineer, recent graduates with related experience are welcome. Technically competent in microcontroller hardware and firmware development. Knowledge of common communication interfaces and protocols, such as RS232, RS485, CAN, I2C, SPI. Practical hands-on skills (debugging, troubleshooting, soldering, harnessing) to support hardware development and testing. Knowledge of control systems and power electronics is preferred. Good analytical skill, resourceful with a creative mind.

Enhance the quality of lesson design and delivery through implementing appropriate teaching and learning strategies and methods. Evaluate curriculum design, development, delivery and assessment to enhance their effectiveness. Spearhead and lead developmental initiatives and industry collaborations, including competitions. Develop and deliver CET programmes, and occasionally support evening lessons Supervise students’ internship and projects Collaborate with industry to enhance students’ learning via field trips and overseas programs, and provide advice to student interest groups What we are looking for Qualification in Computer Engineering/Computer Science/Information Technology or related fields. Having qualifications in Facilities Management will be an added advantage. Minimum 3-6 years of relevant industry experience in the respective field. Process related certifications in Internet of Things (IoTs), Robotic Process Automation (RPA), mobile app development, Smart Building Technology or implementing smart FM technologies at work. What the role is As trustee of the nation’s retirement savings, the Central Provident Fund (CPF) Board helps 4 million CPF members save for their retirement, healthcare and housing needs. Every CPF Ambassador plays a vital role in helping Singaporeans save for a secure retirement. So long as you have the passion and commitment to serve the public, you will find your niche in our big family. Information Technology IT systems form the backbone of our operations. We are looking for individuals with passion and IT expertise, to help us improve the delivery of our systems and services. The Board’s IT systems support a high daily volume of financial transactions for CPF members. In addition to keeping the lights on, the Board also keeps pace with the external environment through innovation in its IT systems. What you will be working on The job holder will be responsible for producing content for digital and non-digital services and oversees content design to ensure consistency and quality. The job holder must love words and language, and is passionate about designing style, grammar, tone, and voice to meet user needs. Empathetic to user values and needs, and the ability to own your copy, communicate your process and present your work to others will be crucial. Plan, write, edit, test and improve digital and non-digital content including interface language, education materials, feature names, navigational nomenclature and other content throughout the CPF experience Help apply and maintain consistency with content standards, and evolve CPF's voice Collaborate with UX researchers/designers to influence page layout, interactions, and visual design to create a consistent end-to-end experience Developing processes for the UX writing practice What we are looking for Relevant experience writing/editing content across different content type (e.g. user interfaces, microcopy, user education, direct or transactional emails/letters, style guides etc) Resilient to work under pressure Passionate about creating experiences that fuse non-digital and digital through research, analytics, design and delivery Sense of pride in presenting well-written, on-brand, error-free work. A deep understanding of UX and how copy and design support each other is a bonus Position will be on a 2-year contract Seniority of appointment will commemorate with relevant work experience

Job_Title: VP, RMG Data Governance Specialist with Unit COO support - (WD25455)
Job_Descriptions: Job Description VP, RMG Data Governance Specialist with Unit COO support, Risk Management Group - (WD25455) Business Function Risk Management Group works closely with our business partners to manage the bank's risk exposure by balancing its objective to maximise returns against an acceptable risk profile. We partner with origination teams to provide financing, investments and hedging opportunities to our customers. To manage risk effectively and run a successful business, we invest significantly in our people and infrastructure. As a RMG Data Governance Specialist who will support the data management practice of Risk Management Group, which is to execute the 4 pillars of the DBS Data Governance Model: Data Ownership, Data Discoverability, Data Quality and Data Access. And also taking lead roles in some Data Management related exercises (e.g. DDOM, BCBS239 annual review, ADA Data Ingestion projects). Responsibilities Data Governance Support DataFirst initiatives on Bank-wide governance according to expectation. Work with RMG Data Champions to ensure the pillars of Bank's Data Management Policy and Standards on the 4 pillars are satisfactorily executed in RMG. Attend the monthly Data Governance Committee (DGC) and disseminate information to RMG Data Champions for follow up if applicable. Ensure issues in the RMG Data Quality Log are properly followed up, status reported and resolved within expected timelines. Ensure Critical Data Attributes have Date Quality monitoring in place. Ensure RMG owned data has complete and proper business metadata in place Ensure RMG data has identified owners. Ensure Data users to have proper data access timely. Ensure annual review of BCBS239 reports are properly faciliated among RMG units and overseas locations, and information are kept up to date in the metadata documentation system. Support DDOM exercises in RMG units READ Unit COO Work with Risk Platform Leads and Tribe Leads to ensure Risk Platform's performance scores at year end meet targets. Ensure READ Unit Financials are tracked properly with actual expenses and headcount stay within budget. Support RMG-wide exercise and to achieve within targets. What the role is Job Purpose Drive international air traffic management (ATM) collaboration efforts to advance Singapore’s capabilities in the ATM domain, expand CAAS’ international outreach with like-minded partners, and advocate Singapore’s interests. What we are looking for Relevant training and experience from aviation, business or public administration, or systems engineering fields or political science or international relations. Detail oriented, able to process large amounts of information to write succinctly, able to conceptualise and think strategically, and propose solutions amidst complex ATM policy and technological issues. Excellent analytical, written and verbal communication skills to be able to present and communicate with senior management and international audiences. Excellent interpersonal skills to influence and drive win-win outcomes with stakeholders and partners.

Job_Title: VP, Treasury & Investments Product Manager, Business Banking
Job_Descriptions: About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Retail function provides Personal and Business Banking customers with financial solutions tailored to their needs. We help them manage their money wisely and meet their financial goals through an extensive range of products and services. These include deposit, insurance, secured and unsecured loans, investment and wealth advisory services. Business Banking We develop integrated products and services targeted at helping small and medium-sized enterprises across the region progress through different stages of growth. These include innovative solutions and initiatives in areas of working capital loans, operational efficiency and currency exposure. Job Responsibilities - Drive & deliver the FX and Investment revenue targets, including launch of new treasury / investment products suitable for BB clients - Develop & implement digital adoption & engagement strategy to convert customers to self service and transact FX online - Work closely with key stakeholders including Global Markets, UOBAM, Sales/Channels, Portfolio  Analytics, Compliance and etc to drive sustainanble growth for the product. - Ideate campaigns & product bundling to increase product penetration to existing customer base - Maximize outreach programs to scale acquiisiton of new FX customers, inlcuding identifying new sources for high quality leads - Regular review of risk controls & supporting internal compliance testing activities. - Preparation of management reports to help track and review business activities as well as performance against budget. - Ensure smooth end to end sales process for referrals to Global Markets & UOBAM Job Requirements - Has strong business accumen with at least 5 years of experience in SME/Large Corporate lending space ( prior experience as sales in a bank/financial institution will be an advantage ) - Possesses flair and keen interest in developing strategy around digital adoption & engagement - Strong data story telling ability, drawing insights & devising action plans from the data - Excellent interpersonal, communication and written skills required. - Ability to multi task and enjoys working in a dynamic working environment - Highly focused, self-driven and willingness to take on additional initatives/tasks to drive key business strategy Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.

What the role is SENIOR / ASSISTANT PROJECT ENGINEER, SIGNALLING What you will be working on You will play a supportive role in reviewing design submissions and working closely with Contractors for supply, design, install, test and commission of the signalling and Platform Screen Doors systems for Downtown Line, Thomson East Coast Line, Jurong Region Line and enhancement to Existing Lines. You will assist to manage the safety, quality, progress and environmental impact of the Contractors' works. Job_Title: SENIOR MANAGER/MANAGER/SENIOR ENGINEER/EXECUTIVE ENGINEER ASSET ENGINEERING (SYS
Job_Descriptions: What the role is SENIOR MANAGER/MANAGER/SENIOR ENGINEER/EXECUTIVE ENGINEER ASSET ENGINEERING (SYSTEMS) What you will be working on You will work closely with the Operators and LTA design and project engineers to deliver Signalling, Communication and Control systems/equipment with DBfOM considerations to ensure operability and maintainability towards high reliability and availability of Signalling, Communication and Control systems/equipment Your responsibilities would cover most or some of the following depending on your experience and seniority. Review requirements and provide inputs on Design and Build for Operations & Maintenance and Life Cycle Management for Signalling, Communication and Control systems/equipment assets of new and existing lines, renewal and replacement projects. Evaluate scope and justifications of Asset Modifications and Renewal proposals to ensure maintainability, supportability and cost-effectiveness. Oversee asset enhancement plans, condition monitoring capabilities, asset failure corrective plans to improve asset reliability and availability. Oversee the transfer of asset between Operator and LTA; account for and manage asset inventory, approve and track configurations changes and disposal of assets throughout their service life. Plan and conduct maintenance audits and asset condition audits to maintain oversight of Operators’ maintenance quality and existing asset condition. Review asset management reports by Operators to upkeep good maintenance standards, as required What we are looking for Requirements: Tertiary qualification in Mechanical, Electrical, Electronic, Systems or Control Engineering discipline Relevant engineering experience in Signalling, Communication, Control, Maintenance Management would be an advantage Have a strong analytical mind, ability to solve problems creatively, exercise good judgement, and work well independently and with a team. Good communication and interpersonal skills, including strong written language ability required Self-motivated, resourceful and possess a positive attitude Those without experience are welcome to apply

Hiring_Company: Ministry Of Social And Family Development
Job_Title: Assistant Executive/ Executive (ComCare & Social Support Division), CSSD/SPSG
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The ComCare and Social Support Division (CSSD) oversees policy, operations policy and service development matters for low-income and vulnerable groups. Our division focuses on individuals or families facing financial difficulty, multiple needs or complex issues, with the aim of supporting them towards achieving stability and resilience. What you will be working on Reporting to the Manager/Social and Residential Support Branch, your duties will include the following: Support implementation of client assessment tool and other capability building initiatives for residential homes Assist with data analysis, establish and maintain data repository and dashboards, to support policy work Conduct desktop research to support CSSD’s projects and policy analyses Provide administrative and logistics support for pilots and research projects that CSSD undertakes or commissions Coordinate returns and maintain records for CSSD’s budget matters Carry out secretariat duties for selected meetings with external stakeholders What we are looking for To meet the challenges of this role, you should be: - proficient in using statistical software, e.g. SPSS to conduct statistical analyses - proficient in MS Office Applications such as Outlook, Microsoft Word, Excel and Power Point. - able to learn fast on the job - meticulous and able to work independently and as part of a team Preference will be given to those with experience in conducting social science research or programme evaluation or who have experience in assessment tool development.

What the role is ASSISTANT ENGINEER (ROAD / EXPRESSWAY / TUNNEL / BRIDGE) What you will be working on You will assist the Engineer in the maintenance planning for road infrastructure assets (roads, expressways, tunnels, bridges and road related facilities). The scopes include: a. Managing the daily operation and maintenance of road infrastructure assets; b. Preparing and issuing work service order / instruction to contractors and consultants; c. Handling public feedback; d. Managing site matters / incidents; e. Formulating long term maintenance plan for all assets; and f. Conducting inspection audits. What we are looking for Requirements: Diploma in Civil or Structural Engineering Relevant experience in bridge or road design, construction, rehabilitation and maintenance, material testing will be added advantage; Good knowledge of construction materials such as asphalt, reinforced / pre-stressed concrete, steel etc are preferred Strong analytical and communication skills Good writing and interpersonal skills

Job_Title: Assistant Service Quality Officer - E Div
Job_Descriptions: What the role is As a Service Quality Officer in Tanglin Division, you will assist the Service Quality Branch to manage service quality matters, such as handling public feedback and complaints; recognising and rewarding officers for good service delivery; and training staff to deliver better service, to ensure that the land division delivers high standard of service at every interaction with the community, so as to discharge the Police mission more effectively. You will be placed under the Management Executive Scheme. What you will be working on You are required to ensure all feedback received at the Division are promptly followed up and customers’ issues addressed. You are also required to analyze service statistics and ensure prompt submission of monthly service quality returns. You will also assist in audits, risks, service awards and training matters. You will have to work closely with the NPCs within the Division to provide guidance on the routine and new service-related initiatives. What we are looking for We are looking for a pro-active and dynamic individual to be part of our Team. Requirements: Fields of studies in Business, Engineering or other relevant fields; Possess strong analytical and writing skills; Meticulous and independent worker who is able to carry out your responsibilities with minimum supervision; Possess effective interpersonal and communication skills; Good time management and be able to meet tight deadlines; and Good Knowledge of Microsoft Office suite (e.g. Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint). * Our officers may be deployed to frontline positions or have frequent interactions with members of the public. Candidates who are not fully vaccinated and do not intend to get vaccinated have higher risk of COVID complications and will not be considered for the position.

Job_Title: DEPUTY / ASSISTANT MANAGER, BUS LICENCE SERVICES
Job_Descriptions: What the role is DEPUTY / ASSISTANT MANAGER, BUS LICENCE SERVICES What you will be working on You will be part of the team responsible for the processing of Public Service Vehicle (“PSV”) Licences for buses. You will be involved in vetting staff’s recommendations on applications for new and renewal of PSV Licences, conducting policy and rules reviews to ensure its relevance and effectiveness and monitoring the bus operators’ compliance with the licensing conditions. In the course of work, you will need to liaise frequently with LTA divisions, government agencies, bus operators, private organisations and community leaders, as well as attend to public feedback. You will also be tasked to review work processes and guidelines to improve efficiency and effectiveness of the team. What we are looking for Requirements: Tertiary qualification in any discipline At least 3 years in a supervisory position Strong written, analytical, communication and interpersonal skills Independent and able to take the initiative to resolve issues to meet deadlines Proven leadership skills, able to motivate team member, as well as a strong team player Able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment

What the role is MANAGER, COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIP What you will be working on We are looking for dynamic and creative professionals to be a part of our dedicated team spearheading efforts in a community-centric organisation to understand the ground, foster closer community relations and respond to ideas, suggestions and requests on road operational issues. You will have the opportunity to engage the community to explain the rationale of our various policies / procedures where needed; and the activation of measures or actions to bring about an improved living environment. You will provide value-add to the community by interacting with them through meetings with grassroots organisations, carry out public education programmes and publicity campaigns on LTA’s initiatives at community gatherings and co-organise community events with grassroots. What we are looking for Requirements: Tertiary qualification in Engineering, Mass Communications or a related discipline At least 3 years of experience in people-related work in a large and dynamic organisation Relevant experience in public education, event management or project stakeholders engagement Knowledge of LTA works, preferably on road, rails and community infrastructure projects as well as experience in working with the communities and grassroots organisation will be an advantage Committed and resourceful with a keen interest in problem-solving Able to multi-task and work independently in a fast-paced environment Good writing, communication and interpersonal skills

Job_Title: PRINCIPAL EXECUTIVE / SENIOR EXECUTIVE / EXECUTIVE, MONITORING
Job_Descriptions: What the role is PRINCIPAL EXECUTIVE / SENIOR EXECUTIVE / EXECUTIVE, MONITORING What you will be working on You will be trained in the operations and usage of specialised equipment and info-management systems. Being proficient in the usage of the monitoring and data systems, you will perform continuous horizon scanning for out-of-the-ordinary events and occurrences. You will perform routine checks on systems and communications in the Land Transport Operations Centre (LTOC), and ensure their operability. You will also monitor and update Staff Aids, collate information and assist in other ad-hoc assignments. What we are looking for Requirements: Diploma in any discipline Able to handle unpredictable situations, and be ready to apply emergency response plans and Standard Operating Procedures Able to perform shift duties

What the role is EXECUTIVE ENGINEER, ROAD SAFETY ENGINEERING What you will be working on You will play an active role in LTA's Strategic Thrusts through the design, implementation and review of road safety programs and projects to make our roads safer. As a road safety engineer, you will assist in developing road safety strategy and driving projects that will improve our road safety to meet customers' needs. You will also be given the opportunity to work with other relevant divisions, external professionals and agencies. This is a dynamic and fulfilling career for those who are technically-trained and people-oriented. What we are looking for Requirements: Tertiary qualification in Civil Engineering, preferably with 2 years’ experience in traffic engineering or transportation fields Possess initiative and leadership skills with lateral thinking aptitude Able to work in a team Class 3 driving licence is preferred as you are required to conduct site checks and assessment of the site Good knowledge of CAD software such as AutoCAD/Microstation

Fund Compliance Intermediate Analyst Job Description You will assist in post-trade compliance, assist in the monitoring of the investment and transactional activities of fund managers to ensure compliance with regulatory and client-mandated investment guidelines. You will also ensure that all client reporting are done accurately and on a timely basis. As our fund managers invest in a broad range of instruments, you should have some knowledge in various financial securities products. Responsibilities Review and maintenance of accurate compliance rules across all fund types, in accordance with Investment guidelines or compliance parameters provided by client / fund manager. Ensure accurate and correct interpretation of guidelines and the creation of relevant rules in the compliance monitoring system. Ensure that alerts and / or breaches are monitored daily and follow-up action taken and documented. Updating of Operating Procedures Manual and Operating Memorandums with clients. By adhering to guidelines and checklists, ensure that standard procedures and controls, as set out in the Operating Procedures Manual, are being adhered to. Responsible for ensuring that all the daily / non-daily reporting to clients are met as per requirements. Attend to client queries. Assist Funds Compliance Monitoring Manager in the smooth running of the compliance monitoring function of the department, including adherence to corporate and regulatory policies and requirements. Assist in process improvement initiatives. Assist in training and development of new or inexperienced staff. Assist in user acceptance testing. Working with internal/external parties (for example clients, fund managers, vendors, fund accountants, auditors etc) Qualifications/Requirements Degree in Banking / Finance or Accountancy 4 - 6 years experience in the financial industry (fund management / insurance business will be preferred) with relevant experience in post-trade compliance platforms, creating and maintaining rules for purposes of portfolio compliance. Knowledge of the various component feeds to the system (fund accounting data base, third party vendor feeds) will be an added advantage. Strong working knowledge of investment guidelines, securities ratings and industry classification, benchmark indexes, etc. Demonstrating a high level of accuracy and attention to detail. Ability to write macros and rule logic, knowledge of SQL and data mapping will be a plus. Computer literate with good working knowledge of Excel & macros. Preferably with working knowledge of SQL and data mapping. Able to interpret legal clauses and paraphrase into simple and clear requirements. Service-oriented and client focused. A team player with strong oral, written and interpersonal communication skills. Willing to work on Singapore public holidays. Job Details Provide application architecture guidelines, patterns, and best practices for architecting cloud native applications with microservices and micro-frontends. Assess and analyse functional and non-functional requirements and provide the best fit application design adhering to architectural guidelines and enterprise architecture strategy. Mentor engineers, developers, business analysts etc on cloud native application design and build. Work closely with scrum masters, business analysts, enterprise architects to ensure all application architecture design is well understood, agreed and accepted. Assess system design and implementation for core banking systems and provide strategy and pattern to revamp such systems to cloud native microservices based applications Provide guidance to developers/engineers on complex implementation and coding issues. Be part of a learning culture, where teamwork and collaboration are encouraged, excellence is rewarded, and diversity is respected and valued. *LI-VW Qualifications Preferably 7 years of experience in technology consulting, enterprise and solutions architecture and architectural frameworks in Java/J2ee technologies. Preferably 3 years of experience in Micro-services architecture, Messaging (MQ, Kafka). Nice to have experience in Cloud, and infrastructure setup. Exceptional communication skills and the demonstrable ability to communicate appropriately at all levels of the organization; this includes written and verbal communications as well as visualizations. Must be a team player able to work effectively at all levels of an organization with the ability to influence others to move toward consensus. Must be highly reliable, trustworthy, honest, and commitment oriented. Strong situational analysis and decision-making abilities. Experience in defining new architectures and ability to drive an independent project from an architectural standpoint. Good experience in thought leadership, white papers and mentoring of staff and internal consulting teams. Experience and knowledge of Financial Industry Risks & Compliance or Management & Controls type of application systems will be advantageous.

Job_Title: DEPUTY / ASSISTANT MANAGER, TRANSIT OPERATOR PERFORMANCE MANAGEMENT
Job_Descriptions: What the role is DEPUTY / ASSISTANT MANAGER, TRANSIT OPERATOR PERFORMANCE MANAGEMENT What you will be working on You will play a key role in managing the rail operator’s and contractors’ performance in terms of operations and maintenance of MRT systems to ensure high reliability and availability of train service. You will assist in planning and conducting audits on rail operators and contractors’ operations and maintenance processes, procedures and execution to ensure that the rail operators and contractors comply with their procedures, work instructions and also with contractual requirements. During the course of the work, you are expected to liaise with various parties, such as rail operators, contractors, project teams, designers, government agencies, etc. You will be involved in technical discussion, design review, system interface, testing and commissioning, investigations arising from service delays, train faults and equipment component failures and incidents. In addition, you will assist in planning and managing the risks and cash-flows of the contracts as well as the issuance of instructions and assessment of payments / variations / claims. You will also assist in preparation of technical / tender specifications, and participate in tender evaluation, award and managing of new contracts. We are looking for suitable candidates to work on the following systems / disciplines: 1) Communications-based train control (CBTC) Signalling and Platform Screen Door Systems 2) Integrated Supervisory Control System (ISCS), Maintenance Management System and Communication System 3) Rolling Stock and Depot Equipment 4) Mechanical Services, Electrical Services and Power Supply System 5) Permanent Way, Civil and Structure What we are looking for Requirements: Tertiary qualification in Engineering At least 3 years of design or operation and maintenance experience in large-scale infrastructure projects Have good appreciation of the constraints and interface requirements of electrical, mechanical and civil works Strong project management and leadership skills with proven track records Good communication (both oral and written) as well as presentation skills A team player who is meticulous, analytical, resourceful and results-oriented and able to multi-task and work within tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment Familiarity with relevant local railway and building regulations, codes and standards will be an advantage Experience in the design, operations and maintenance of underground MRT stations preferred Candidates with very good relevant experience may be considered for senior positions

Job_Title: SVP/ VP, Team Head, Credit Control, Risk Management Group - (WD30298)
Job_Descriptions: Business Function Risk Management Group works closely with our business partners to manage the bank's risk exposure by balancing its objective to maximise returns against an acceptable risk profile. We partner with origination teams to provide financing, investments, and hedging opportunities to our customers. To manage risk effectively and run a successful business, we invest significantly in our people and infrastructure. Key Accountabilities Overseas and manages groupwide digitalisation and automation projects/ initiatives for IBG, FIG, T&M, WM CCU Ensure alignment across the group Ensure projects are completed on time Ensure the practices in CCU are aligned across the group Achieve the KPI set for each initiative Responsibilities Review the reports prepared by CCU locations, eliminate, or digitise/automate the reports Achieve 20% reduction in reports group wide Complete and roll out the Real time Exceptional Approval Workflow system Complete and roll out the End of Day Excess workflow system Review requests from CCU locations and ensure alignment across the group Enhance/streamline processes across the group Requirements Knowledge of and experience in banking and financial services in corporate banking is an advantage Project Management skills Experience working with overseas markets in Corporate Banking Strategic planning for Business or Support Unit Strong communication, interpersonal and analytical skills Degree in Banking and Finance or Business Administration preferred Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

What the role is ENGINEER, TRAFFIC SCHEME DESIGN DEVELOPMENT What you will be working on You will play an active role in the planning, design, implementation and review of traffic schemes in Singapore. You will offer professional advice to developers, consultants and other agencies on traffic plans and studies. Besides exercising your professional judgement, you will also develop your interpersonal skills through interaction and communication with the community and various stakeholders. You will also spearhead projects that will enhance the travel experience of commuters, motorists and cyclists, to create an improved living environment for all road users. We offer a dynamic working environment to those with technical and analytical abilities and who enjoy challenging boundaries. What we are looking for Requirements: Tertiary qualification in Civil / Traffic / Transportation Engineering At least 2 years of experience in Traffic / Transportation-related or operational fields / familiar with highway design Possess initiative, good communication and leadership skills with lateral thinking ability Class 3 driving licence is preferred Knowledge of Traffic Microsimulation is an advantage

Job_Title: Senior Associate, Strategic Projects Hong Kong Lending Project Manager (WD29846)
Job_Descriptions: Business Function The Institutional Banking Group provides corporate customers with a full range of commercial banking products and services, including cash management services, current accounts, time deposits, trade finance, working capital finance, term loans and foreign exchange. Through our continued commitment, DBS has cultivated long-standing relationships with its customers in the region that are based on account relationship management, service differentiation, product development and rigorous credit standards. Responsibilities Obtain a clear understanding the scope and business objectives of SME regional lending and the regional playbook standard of workflows to granular level of details, so that learnings and best practices can be shared with local country. Analyse and gain deep knowledge of end to end business lending processes and objectives for unsecured loans, secured loans, trade, FX, etc. in local country, and ideate and recommend controls and design workflows to improve current productivity and efficiency and flow, to reduce manual errors and improve turnaround time. Define project requirements and breakdown complex issues into well defined project milestones and phases, and proactively monitor progress by tracking activities, and delegate clear tasks to local programme manager, Business Analysts and Testers. Play a governance role in ensuring that the design in terms of the workflow, data flows and process steps are harmonized and consistent with lending strategy. Collate and rationalize all stakeholders' requirements, and walkthrough these requirements with stakeholders, including users, technology, UIUX designers, etc.. Provide regular, structured reporting and status updates to all impacted stakeholders and senior management, highlighting any key risks or issues. Independently drive stakeholder meetings with clear communication and meeting objectives, to resolve differing ideas and reach consensus on solution to implement. Requirements: Prior experience as a Program/Project Manager in Front Office/IT for SME banking for corporate lending and onboarding products is strongly preferred. Preferable to have minimum of 5-7 years work experience in Program Manager/Project Manager roles in Banking Market and business knowledge in SME Banking, familiarization with SME customer needs and internal business processes for lending and account opening is preferred. Project Management and Digital Implementation Experience Strong stakeholder management and communication skills, proven track record in managing stakeholders Able to adapt quickly and work in a fast paced environment, and systematically breakdown complex issues into well-structured solutions that are thought through end to end. Good understanding of the lending business and processes, from loan origination and application to disbursement, and account application to creation. Highly meticulous, detailed and logical in thought processes and clear and articulate communication skills, strong process improvement and strategic thinking skills Good understanding of the Digital & SME competitor landscape Awareness of Project management tools and methodologies like AGILE, JIRA, Confluence, etc. Able to work independently and as part of a team squad, and be extremely organized with strong time management skills Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Project Manager We are currently working with one of the biggest consumer goods companies in the world, who place a focus on product excellence and R&D. They are currently on the lookout for a project manager to be a part of their highly visible critical projects within the infrastructure space. The Role Project management and delivery of key Estate projects delivering all IT services for a new office. Generate key project setup documents detailing scope, assumptions, success criteria, risks, and IT governance structure. Manage key interdependencies via working with the programme manager. Solid risk management skills with the ability to keep close and flag out potential roadblocks before they occur. Manage changes in project scope, costs, resources and timing within the framework of agreed governance and change control processes. Work with the various stakeholders to negotiate contracts with external suppliers/vendors. Manage the relationship with external vendors to ensure timely and quality delivery. Manage the budget and financials. Together with business stakeholders curate quality business cases for projects Create detailed and accurate budgets for programme manager review. Track and measure business case realization in close partnership with Business Stakeholders. Ensure ownership for quality and accuracy of project management performance and deliverables, you cannot settle for average as excellence is the standard. You have Experience in IT Infrastructure Project Management (e.g. Network, server, storage, datacentre) in relation to new office builds or office relocations Experience managing and engaging external vendors in relation to the fit out and construction of new office spaces (General Contractors, M&E Consultants, Cabling contractors etc.) Network focused project delivery experience; networks, WAN into the building, LAN and WAN distribution into the building. End User Computing project delivery for 800+ users: monitors/desk/AV/collaboration solutions including meeting rooms/collaboration spaces and services. Ability to represent the whole of IT at large cross functional stakeholder meetings run by the Estates and General Contractor teams. Good knowledge and experience of all stages of the project and programme lifecycle, including development of business cases, mobilisation of programmes. Strong stakeholder management for both internal and external parties Experience of delivering large sized projects with budgets > 1 million dollars Experience of successfully leading large multi-disciplinary project teams potentially across multiple organisations and locations. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. For more information you can email Brandon Hon in our Singapore office at brandon.hon@teksystems.com quoting Job Reference 523757 or alternatively, apply here to register your interest. http://jobs.en-sg.teksystems.com/BUnwhS/project-manager-itcommunications-singapore-singapore-14730923 Allegis Group Singapore Pte Ltd, Company Reg No. 200909448N, EA Licence No. 10C4544

What the role is The Centre for Urban Greenery and Ecology (CUGE), a division of the National Parks Board, conducts applied research in various aspects of urban greenery and ecology, including arboriculture, urban ecosystems, sustainable landscaping, and people-nature interactions. Our vision is to be the regional centre for advancing and sharing knowledge in the use of greenery and ecology to enhance our tropical urban living environment. We are looking for a qualified research scientist to develop and manage projects on urban tree growth and tree health. In particular, the candidate will have expertise and experience working on the rhizosphere, and other below-ground aspects of urban tree research, or on tree physiology. Besides being part of a larger group looking at the broader urban greenery and ecology research theme, the candidate will focus on a research programme to inform the future planning, and sustainable maintenance of Singapore’s urban trees. The person will be expected to oversee a range of urban tree research projects, including growth modelling, tree vitality assessment, demographic studies, root health and anchorage strength, etc. These research efforts will be expected to produce tangible outcomes in terms of tree management and the positive experience of trees by people in cities like Singapore What you will be working on As part of CUGE, you will work within a team to manage research projects on urban trees. Your duties will include: Providing sound technical advice on tree management issues Managing multiple research projects carried out by third parties for research quality, governance, and translational outcomes Directly participating in selected projects, including sharing and promoting scientific insights through publications and presentations, and Acting as intermediary between external research performers and practitioners to facilitate the communication and application of newly developed knowledge by practitioners What we are looking for PhD in urban forestry, tree biology, geotechnical engineering, tree physiology, or an urban tree-related field Strong written and oral communication skills to effectively convey knowledge to diverse stakeholders, ranging from peer researchers to non-research colleagues working in operational or management/policy roles Demonstrated ability to clearly frame research questions, design studies, analyse data, and interpret findings Adaptable, with good interpersonal skills and the ability to work with other research teams and key stakeholders in government, industry, and academia. Preferably with three years of relevant research and work experience Preferably with experience in numerical modelling/ programming/statistical analyses Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job_Title: DEPUTY / ASSISTANT MANAGER, PUBLIC TRANSPORT PROMOTION
Job_Descriptions: What the role is DEPUTY / ASSISTANT MANAGER, PUBLIC TRANSPORT PROMOTION What you will be working on You will be involved in project planning, project management, data collation and analysis, as well as providing insights and developing possible solutions. You will be required to plan and coordinate new public transport promotion initiatives that help create a more inclusive and accessible transport system for vulnerable commuters. These include implementing initiatives to dynamically manage and influence commuters’ caring behaviour towards others who are in need while taking public transport. You will also be working on projects to influence travel patterns in our public transport system, for example, by encouraging off-peak travel to ease the train crowdedness during peak periods. You will have the opportunities to work closely with different stakeholders including government agencies, non-profit organisations, professionals and public transport operators on various initiatives. What we are looking for Requirements: Tertiary qualification in any discipline At least 3 years of relevant experience in project management with flair for research and benchmarking Good knowledge in Microsoft Office applications, especially Word, Powerpoint and Excel Good writing, analytical, communication and interpersonal skills Energetic, self-motivated, able to work well under pressure and tight timeline Must be meticulous with an eye for detail and able to manage vendors, stakeholders, internal and external customers Highly adaptable, independent, positive team player and multi-task in a dynamic environment

What the role is DEPUTY DIRECTOR, EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS What you will be working on You will supervise a team of staff to develop and implement plans to ensure that LTA is suitably equipped and its staff well trained and ready to respond and manage any emergencies in the land transport sector. You will lead your team to work closely with stakeholders in LTA, its licensees and other government agencies to conceptualise, formulate and recommend policies on emergency preparedness, business continuity planning and crisis management. This includes COVID19-related response plans and operations to ensure the continuity of essential services in the land transport sector. You will also lead your team to plan and conduct audits/exercises to validate and improve the capabilities and coordination between LTA, its licensees and government agencies to cope with emergencies. What we are looking for Requirements: Tertiary qualification in any discipline At least 10 years of relevant experience, with at least 3 years' experience in a management role Good critical thinking, analytical and planning skills Good interpersonal and communication skills Ability to engage internal/external stakeholders and negotiate effectively Ability to work under pressure and adapt to changes Excellent leadership and managerial skills

You will also be required to develop and maintain a comprehensive cost database relating to assets-replacement projects.
