Job_Title: Executive to Assistant Manager (Residential Homes Licensing & Special Projects),
Job_Descriptions: What the role is Residential Homes Licensing (RHL) is under the Enforcement and Licensing Group. RHL licenses and inspects social residential homes to ensure the safety and welfare of the residents and raise the standard of care in these facilities. You will be part of a team of licensing officers who will be working closely with other Divisions in the Ministry, executive volunteers as well as stakeholders from the residential facilities. We are looking for passionate and committed officers to join us. Successful candidate will be placed on a 2-year non-renewable contract. What you will be working on Provide secretariat and administrative support to the Review Board and its Committees, Discharge Committee and Boards of Visitors (including organising of meetings, compilation of meeting materials, minutes-taking, visits coordination, etc.) Follow-up on issues/concerns arising from feedback by executive volunteers and other stakeholders Conduct inspections on social residential homes and check on compliance with existing legislation, regulatory requirements and internal guidelines Be part of a research and development projects team that support licensing framework and processes Be part of a project team to develop an IT system to facilitate the team’s licensing and inspections work Manage queries from members of public and stakeholders Undertake any other duties assigned by supervisor What we are looking for Tertiary qualifications in any discipline Experience in developing IT projects, administrative duties and strong writing skills would be an advantage Keen interest in working with the residential care sector, social policies and business processes Good written and verbal communication skills Adept at engaging and collaborating with partners/stakeholders Curious mindset, strong analytical skills and has a keen eye for details Self-driven and motivated, and able to work well in a team and fast-paced environment

Job_Title: Senior Analyst/Principal Analyst (Market Development & Surveillance Dept)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is Senior Analyst/Principal Analyst (Market Development & Surveillance Dept) What you will be working on You will be part of a team responsible for designing policies and enforcing regulations to ensure a competitive retail electricity market and protect consumer interests. The team will play a significant role in the Singapore Energy Transition, working on key projects including the design of regulated electricity tariff post-vesting and frameworks and/or instruments to support entry of electricity imports. You will also play in role in managing the rollout of advanced electricity meters in Singapore, including the current multi-agency trial to leverage on telcos' Narrowband Internet-of-Things network for remote meter reading purposes. We also conduct market surveillance and monitor performance of the retail electricity market to ensure that our policies are effective and sustainable. you are also expected to engage consumers to address their queries and feedback on matters related to retail electricity market. What we are looking for Education in Economics, Mathematics, Accountancy, Finance, Business or Engineering. Proven work experience in energy markets, utilities metering, consumer protection, or competition law and regulation. Hands-on experience in project management of testbeds or technical trials involving residential, commercial and/or industrial customers is preferred. Possess strong technical skills in the use of data analytics and visualization to develop insights for policy design and market monitoring purposes. Knowledge of Python scripting is a plus. Problem solver with excellent negotiation and communication (written and verbal) skills. Ability to work under tight timelines and manage multiple stakeholders. We are looking for a team player, with a strong interest to develop Singapore's retail electricity market.

Business Function As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business - they were made just right for you. Responsibilities Provide support to the Distribution and Treasures business Develop and manage performance and incentive dashboards to monitor performance while providing analytical insights that supports business goals Enable business to manage staff personal development through the enhancement and maintenance of the KPI Balanced Scorecard framework Generate, review and analyse other performance related metrics and dashboards for key stakeholders Support the annual reports review and budget forecasting that includes establishing assumptions, analysis and preparation of presentation decks Support the automation initiatives of performance related and incentive dashboards Assist on any ad-hoc tasks as required by the dept Requirements A minimum of 4-6 years of experience in financial services industry; preferably in performance management and scorecard development Knowledge in Consumer Banking and Wealth Products would be an advantage Project management skills with a sense of urgency Business acumen and data analytical ability to identify trends, risks and opportunities Detailed oriented and comfortable working with larget amounts of data Intermidiate to expert level user of Microsoft Excel, Access and Powerpoint; knowledge in Excel Macro (VBA) and/or SQL would be an added advantage Good team player and willing to learn and guide others Good stakeholder management skills and comfortable communicating with senior management Apply Now​ We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

What the role is You will be part of a team working with various stakeholders within HDB and with external agencies to administer corporate IT systems and drive ICT initiatives/projects for HDB. What you will be working on You will be required to review and analyse business needs, confer with stakeholders to evaluate requirements, discuss solutions and develop plan of approach, analyse existing processes and make recommendations to better streamline the overall processes within the solution. You will be involved in the integration of solution with other business systems and applications used in HDB. You are expected to take a corporate, strategic perspective, whilst understanding the varied business needs and challenges, when administering the systems. You are expected to build up a thorough understanding of the business and to have technical understanding of the systems architecture, to collaborate effectively with the stakeholders, including the development team. You will need to understand the IT and data management policies/guidelines to ensure compliance to these policies and guidelines. You will also be required to do programming to generate computer reports for policy review and analysis and operations. You will also take on coordination work for the Group on IT-related matters. What we are looking for You should possess a background in Information Systems or equivalent, and preferably with at least 2 years of relevant working experience in Project Management and programming. You should be a meticulous, organised and fast learner who have strong analytical, conceptualization and problem-solving skills and can work well in team environment as well as independently. Excellent communication, presentation and writing skills will be an added advantage. All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted for the position within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

What the role is DEPUTY MANAGER, ELECTRONIC PARKING SYSTEM What you will be working on You will be involved in the operations of Electronic Parking Systems (EPS). You are required to liaise and work with Payment Service Providers, customers (i.e. Car Park Owners/Operators), vendors and relevant stakeholders to develop and execute operational plans with regards to the latest IT policies, and to oversee projects related to an EPS Acquirer system for car park payments via different payment modes (e.g. CEPAS cards). You may be required to manage a team to spearhead the implementation of new initiatives and projects to enhance the EPS acquiring business as part of the NEXGEN ERP implementation. What we are looking for Requirements: Tertiary qualification in IT, Engineering, Business Administration or related discipline At least 5 years’ of relevant experience in project management and contract administration of an operational environment Keen interest in transaction acquiring business development, operational works and managing IT systems Good knowledge in ISO9000, or equivalent quality processes Good analytical, interpersonal and communication skills Highly-motivated and pro-active with the ability to work independently

Job_Title: Analyst, Intelligent Bank Lead, Consumer Banking Group - WD30044
Job_Descriptions: Business Function As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business – they were made just right for you. ​​​​​​Job Role The Intelligent Bank team is focused on defining and implementing ‘what’s next’ for DBS after digital, utilising our years of investment in digital capabilities, UX, and real-time customer data, with the objective of creating personalised, relevant, intuitive and meaningful experiences for our customers. We are focused on learning and understanding our customers’ needs, behaviours, motivations and emotions. We explore and discover through customer immersions, experimentation and data. Customer and data insights drives everything we do, from product strategy to design, implementation, go live, and driving results. We work in collaborative, cross-functional squads to solve problems practically, craft and build experiences that will ‘wow’ our customers. Work in a cross-functional manner with product managers, design & research, data science, product delivery, technology and marketing to design, build, test and implement new features of Intelligent Bank Use data to deliver superior customer journeys – from identifying data sources and architecture, to driving data analysis for planned features and customer journeys, to making data-based recommendations and solutions Help drive execution to timelines, including handling unexpected issues and engaging relevant stakeholders in changes Lead, enable and assist a country team (e.g. Indonesia or India) from concept to design, through to build and implementation of Intelligent Bank Develop deep customer insights through customer immersions which will guide product and feature development for each market Requirement Creative spirit, love for design and solving problems Talent and enthusiasm Problem solver with analytical skills Curious about behaviour and culture change Ability to identify and pursue issues end to end until they are resolved Team player, works well with others, manages stakeholders effectively A plus would be a history of building something new through challenges (e.g., building a business, of your own or within a company / department) Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

What the role is The Animal & Veterinary Service (AVS), a cluster of NParks, safeguards the health and welfare of animals through comprehensive and integrated programmes and works closely with partners in the veterinary and animal-related industries to strengthen capacities and enhance competencies in animal health and welfare. It is the main touchpoint on animal and veterinary matters in Singapore and the First Responder for all animal-related feedback. It also conducts public education and engagement programmes to foster a humane and gracious society for all, where pet owners, communities, and animals co-exist in greater harmony within our biophilic City in Nature. What you will be working on As a Manager in the Animal Population Management Section of the Community Animal Management Division, you will be involved in animal population research studies. These include implementing fieldwork study on community animal ecology (i.e., stray cats and dogs). You will assist with population surveys to estimate the free-roaming dog (FRD) population and also assist with studying the movement of the FRDs using tracking technology. You will be involved in field work, data collection, statistical analysis, and scientific report writing. What we are looking for Degree in Ecology, Animal Behaviour, Environmental Science, Biology, Life Sciences or related discipline Keen interest in research and field work Prior experience in ecological field work, data collection, research and statistical analysis is preferable Independent, self-motivated and able to carry out research tasks with little supervision Willing to work weekends and after office hours Possess good writing and communication skills Competent in Microsoft Office Applications Preferably possess a Class 3 vehicle licence Office Location: The office will be situated at: Wallace Education Centre, 50 Dairy Farm Road Singapore 679059 Only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Successful candidates will be offered a 9-month employment contract

Job_Descriptions: What the role is SENIOR/ EXECUTIVE ENGINEER, DEPOT EQUIPMENT & SERVICE VEHICLES DEVELOPMENT What you will be working on You will have the opportunity to further their expertise in technical aspects in one or more of the following areas: rail depot equipment, bus depot equipment, special vehicles and service vehicles. What we are looking for Requirements: Tertiary qualification in Electrical, Electronics or Mechanical Engineering At least 3 years of relevant experience in managing similar engineering projects Good appreciation of interface requirements with civil, electrical and mechanical works Strong project management and leadership skills Good communication and presentation skills A team player who is analytical, resourceful and result-oriented Expected to travel overseas if required

Job_Title: Executive, School Dental Centre (1 year contract)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Health Promotion Board’s vision is to make Singapore a nation of healthier people. Come be a part of this journey if you’re passionate about creating boundary-pushing work that drives behavioral change. You will be a part of HPB’s School Dental Centre, which strives to provide oral health care services to school-going children to ensure good oral health and dental fitness. What you will be working on As a key member of the School Dental Centre team, you will be providing oral health care services to school-going children by providing oral health promotions, dental screenings and treatment. You will be managing the decontamination processes of dental equipment and instruments in SDC’s clinic operations and monitor and document the efficacy of the sterilization cycles in autoclaves. You are also required to maintain high infection control standards and proper storage facilities for sterile dental instruments and materials. And last but not the least, you will be handling the safe disposal of sharps and bio-hazard waste in SDC and perform dental assisting duties to Dental Officers. What we are looking for Join us if you are a dynamic and self-motivated individual and you should also possess: a) Effective social and communication skills b) Effective time management, planning and organisational skills c) Ability to work independently and in a team d) Relevant working experience

Job_Title: EXECUTIVE ENGINEER/ ENGINEER, POWER SUPPLY AND ELECTRICAL SERVICES
Job_Descriptions: What the role is EXECUTIVE ENGINEER/ ENGINEER, POWER SUPPLY AND ELECTRICAL SERVICES What you will be working on You will provide engineering support for projects as well as engineering studies supported and undertaken by the Division. You will be involved in designing high voltage power systems, railway traction power systems and low voltage reticulation schemes; establishing engineering standards; preparing and participating in tenders; handling site supervision, testing and commissioning as well as reviewing technologies for both road and rail infrastructure/ applications and buildings. What we are looking for Requirements: Tertiary qualification in Electrical Engineering At least 3 years of experience in designing and supervising high voltage and low voltage reticulation schemes Knowledge of a railway environment and relevant experience in designing traction systems Good leadership, communication and interpersonal skills Those with more relevant years of experience will be considered for senior positions

What the role is The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies. Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering. As a Senior Manager (Data Science & AI) in GovTech’s Data Science & Artificial Intelligence (DSAI) Division, you will lead and drive initiatives that build DSAI capabilities across the whole-of-government. You will build up strong industry partnerships to engage and support government agencies in their upskilling and uplifting efforts, be it through frameworks and guides we develop, workshops or events we run, or whole-of-government bulk tenders we help manage. You are a decisive and driven individual who takes a proactive approach to running programmes and managing projects to meet overall objectives and targets of the organisation. You can confidently engage business or technical officers from working level to senior executives, including sharing on Data Science & AI topics to a wider audience. When called upon, you can also facilitate, host, or run some technical workshops and seminars. Success in the role will be demonstrated by your ability to effectively lead and run large-scale whole-of-government DSAI capability development initiatives. What you will be working on Lead and manage multiple programmes and projects concurrently with the overall aim to drive data transformation efforts across the whole of government in Data Science & AI. Such programmes and initiatives include, but not limited to: Competency frameworks and training roadmaps; Training workshops, programmes and masterclasses; Community building events; Hackathons and competitions; and Suite of resources (videos, bulk tenders) Develop a strategic sense of key organisations, software and hardware tools, methodologies, and best practices in the Data Science & AI ecosystem, knowing which would be most relevant to the government context. Develop and manage strong partnerships with such key industry players to gain support and involvement in the capability development efforts. Work with companies and organisations to invite tech gurus, luminaries to engage the Data Science & AI community of public officers, initiate new training workshops, sharing sessions, masterclasses on Data Science-related skills. Manage all aspects of the assigned projects independently, including but not limited to programme execution, budgeting, etc. What we are looking for Degree or Diploma in Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent, such as business credentials with a focus on tech. Minimum 5 years of relevant experience, with at least 3 years in the capacity of leading and managing a team. Experience working on large-scale projects from conception to implementation, handling all aspects from planning, budgeting, stakeholder management. Confident in public speaking to a diverse audience group from staff level to senior executives. Strong understanding of the different elements of Data Science & AI, and the general sense of the common tools and products associated with it. Excellent English language skills both oral and written. Comfortable working independently with minimum supervision. Knowledge of some of the tools, experience working in Data Science & AI domain, good understanding of procurement processes especially in a government context, or prior experience in engaging public officers and government agencies on projects and collaborations is a bonus. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s important for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round. Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours

What the role is You will be an integral part of the engineering research team to participate in research & development works in the area of advanced material engineering and environmental sustainability. What you will be working on In this role, you will jointly explore, develop and implement new solutions, technologies and strategies to create quality living environment in HDB towns and to support Singapore’s Green Plan. You will identify research collaboration opportunities, jointly develop research & technology proposals and technology roadmaps. You will also work with a multi-disciplinary team to review initiatives, identify test-bedding areas as well as validate the test-bedding outcomes. This will involve collaboration with multiple stakeholders such as government agencies, industry partners, institutions of higher learnings, town councils and etc. You will have opportunity to explore the use of forefront technologies in the construction of infrastructure project to drive greater productivity and decarbonisation. The research work may also involve use of numerical simulation modelling. What we are looking for You should possess a relevant background in Engineering recognised by the Professional Engineers Board, or in a related discipline. You should have at least 3 years of relevant experiences in civil engineering, material engineering science or relevant experience in environmental sustainability research. Knowledge and project experiences in advanced materials, reduction in embodied carbon and engineering software simulations will be an added advantage. You should possess the ability to conceptualise and write research and funding proposals. You should be a strong communicator, have good interpersonal skills and be able to prepare and deliver clearly both written and verbal presentations to stakeholders. You should also have a driven and “can do” mindset and possess deep analytical skills and use frontier technologies to deep dive and gain faster findings and better insights. All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted for the position within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

What the role is As trustee of the nation’s retirement savings, the Central Provident Fund (CPF) Board helps 4 million CPF members save for their retirement, healthcare and housing needs. Every CPF Ambassador plays a vital role in helping Singaporeans save for a secure retirement. So long as you have the passion and commitment to serve the public, you will find your niche in our big family. Information Technology IT systems form the backbone of our operations. We are looking for individuals with passion and IT expertise, to help us improve the delivery of our systems and services. The Board’s IT systems support a high daily volume of financial transactions for CPF members. In addition to keeping the lights on, the Board also keeps pace with the external environment through innovation in its IT systems. What you will be working on The job holder will be part of the dynamic and resourceful horizontal team in charge of the various digital service platforms belonging to CPF Board such as the website and mobile app. He/She will be part of a cross-functional Agile development team, alongside designers and developers, to chart and execute the product vision of various digital services through reimagining user experience alongside business processes. These include website contents, online application forms, calculators, planners on the CPF website. The Role Provide consultancy to Product Owners through Agile/Scrum development projects, in the area of product vision, business requirements, change management and best practices, which takes into account both CPF Board’s needs and the value to CPF members Prioritise high-value features to be released to ensure maximum value in every release and alignment with product strategy Oversee Agile ceremonies to ensure smooth delivery of releases Drive digital initiatives and enhancements to improve website user experience Manage the digital platforms and its operations such as content publications review and approval, problem management, quality assurance testing etc What we are looking for Experienced in Agile/Scrum project development e.g. familiarity in Agile ceremonies Keen learner with a positive attitude, and ability to work independently Good analytical and problem-solving skills Good organisational and project management skills Good communication skills, and ability to work well with teammates as well as those from other business units Resilient to work under pressure, resourceful and ability to adapt and manage Some degree of familiarity with the following would be preferred but is not mandatory: o Website and/ or mobile app management o User experience/User Interface (UX/UI) design o Business Process Reengineering Required to be on standby after office hours (including weekends and public holidays) upon activation. Position will be on 2-year contract The seniority of appointment will be commensurate with relevant work experience.

Job_Title: Senior/ Forensic Scientist, DNA Profiling Laboratory
Job_Descriptions: What the role is This is a Senior/ Forensic Scientist role which sits under the DNA Profiling Lab, Biology Division. What you will be working on Job Description: Conduct and supervise DNA analysis of crime samples. Interpretation of forensic DNA results. Preparation of reports and provision of expert Court testimony. Conduct statistical analysis and development of new forensic DNA technologies. Assist the Laboratory Director in general laboratory administrative matters and technical staff training. What we are looking for Job Requirements: Background in Life Sciences, with coursework modules in Mendelian Genetics, Biochemistry, and Molecular Biology, or related fields. Background in Life Sciences preferred. Sound life sciences knowledge with proven expertise in molecular biology/genetics as evidenced by publications in international peer-reviewed journals. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Some experience with statistical software (e.g. R, SPSS, SAS) in life sciences setting will be preferable. Familiarity with barcoding metagenomics/WGC on MPS/Nanopore platforms will be an advantage. Pls note that only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

Job_Title: EXECUTIVE ENGINEER/ ENGINEER, SIGNALS, COMMUNICATIONS AND CONTROL
Job_Descriptions: What the role is EXECUTIVE ENGINEER/ ENGINEER, SIGNALS, COMMUNICATIONS AND CONTROL What you will be working on You will provide signals, communications and control support to various current and future transit and traffic projects. You will also provide engineering management support, as well as review and implement the driverless train control system, communications system which includes wide and local area networks, digital trunked radio and computer-based, real-time / mission-critical systems for transit lines or traffic projects. You will be given the opportunity to develop expert knowledge in one or more of the following areas: signals, communications and control systems. What we are looking for Requirements: Tertiary qualification in Electrical / Electronics / Computer Engineering Knowledge of Automatic Train Operation / Protection, SCADA, Maintenance Management System, Access Control System, Fence Intrusion Detection System, wide area network technologies (such as SDH, Gigabit Ethernet, MPLS), wireless LAN technologies, TETRA digital trunked radio, PABX and video surveillance systems will be an added advantage Team player with strong analytical mind and ability to work independently Good communication and interpersonal skills Self-motivated, resourceful and possess a positive attitude Those with more relevant years of experience will be considered for senior positions Those without working experience are welcome to apply

Job_Descriptions: AVP / SnrAssoc, SRE Engineer, EASRE, Technology and Operations - (WD29098) Business Function Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels. Key Responsibilities Drive the Site Reliability Engineering agenda forward at an Enterprise Level to improve availability, reliability, and performance of services. Drive cross-team efforts in resiliency assessment exercises and reporting Draft and/or contribute to internal SRE training materials Support services before they go live through activities such as Chaos testing (failure injection), system design inputs, developing software platforms and frameworks, capacity planning and launch reviews. Very good analytical and problem-solving skills with good understanding of technical risks emerging out of architecture decisions. Experience with developing applications and setting up automations in a Linux environment, with sound knowledge of algorithms, data structures, complexity analysis and software design. Understands complex architectures and well versed with design patterns. Development skills with experience in real time, distributed and highly secured environments. Experience with developing test cases and ensuring appropriate test coverage through unit and automated testing. Experience with one of more of ELK, Grafana, Prometheus, Dynatrace and AppDynamics. Experience with Proxies and Load Balancers like HAProxy and Nginix. Experience with CI/CD pipelines and release strategies Understands key SRE concepts such as Error Budgets, MTTD, MTTR and Launch Control Systematic problem-solving approach coupled with effective communication skills and a sense of ownership and drive. Ability to debug and optimize code and to automate routine tasks. Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, a related technical field that involves programming, or equivalent practical experience. Minimum of 10 years technology experience (preferably in the financial industry). Highly motivated, pro-active and capable of working under pressure without compromising development processes and productivity. Strong, committed and reliable team player, able to take direction but also willing to contribute to discussions on design and strategy. Possess strong interpersonal and communication skills to be able to deal with and form good relationships with the business and other technology groups through day to day support and project work Interest in financial technologies, new technology tools and the ability to learn. Job Purpose T&O-Ops COO Ops Risk  Management  –  RSU  unit  provides  the  full  support  to  DBS  group  in  the management  of  Nostro  &  General  ledger  accounts  reconciliation.  The unit  has  three  functions:- Nostro account reconciliation,  General Ledger reconciliation for Consumer banking business & the Business Management Support (BMS) that manages static data, feeds processes and production of daily MIS The  main  focus  for  this  role  is  to  team  manage  the  day-to-day  BAU  reconciliations  for nostro accounts of DBS entities. Job_Title: AVP, Mass Market Cards Product Manager, Cards &  …
Job_Descriptions: AVP, Mass Market Cards Product Manager, Cards & Unsecured Loans, Consumer Banking Group Business Function As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business - they were made just right for you. Responsibilities Job Purpose Manage and grow the business of Mass Market cards (POSB Everyday Card, Black Card, and other core card products) Grow and entrench DBS' position within the payments space and grow the overall card's profitability. Key Accountabilities Manage growth of Mass Market cards business to grow the overall cards' market share. Job_Title: SVP / VP, Enterprise Agile Coach, Transformation Group  - "[WD20174]
Job_Descriptions: About the Transformation Group Here at the DBS Transformation Group, we focus on nurturing the culture of the “World’s Best Bank” (Euromoney 2018, 2019 and 2020). Our approach is a combination of both science and art. We immerse our stakeholders in the world of design thinking and experimentation, drive rigorous creativity along our innovation pipeline, and build connections between corporate entrepreneurs and start-ups. We are a cross-disciplinary team focused on the invention of solutions that will radically improve the way people live, work and play.  We are passionate and committed to making banking joyful (while having lots of fun)! Job Purpose As the Enterprise Agile Coach, you will have a proven track-record of transforming large enterprises (both Business and IT) to adopt Agile and enable a continuous flow of value by embedding Agile friendly operating models and supporting enablers (e.g. Agile demand management & funding). You will be comfortable with dealing with C-level stakeholders to articulate, influence and coach how we build, and the way we build to address organisational challenges and pain points. In an effort to help deliver business value faster through expert timely intervention and capability development, the role is to enable teams to high performance across the platforms and solve problems using DBS Agile Way of Working by removing systemic blockers. Key Accountabilities The position is accountable for driving enterprise agility through org design, the uplifting capability of the DBS group teams in Agile values, principles and practices for the planning and execution of business value in relation to coaching, mentoring & educating and has the following accountabilities: Being a trusted advisor to senior management: Coach and develop all levels of staff on how to implement and sustain the Agile principles & practices Lead by example and seen as a role model of Agile values, principles and practices Establish a position as an expert in delivery that cultivates business value & risk mitigation Engage senior management and promote business strategies and solutions which drive an Agile culture and make value visible Leverage DBS Group resources to develop a robust-closed-loop policy / strategy deployment process that will strengthen the understanding of strategic direction and provide the goals required to cultivate a business value driven culture Execute the Divisional execution of Platform (IT & Business) strategy for customer  & employee benefit Plan an approach to incorporate Agile WoW the strategic oversight of the customers’ technology investment and assets Collaborate to ensure engagement and support for Agile strategy Work closely with other divisions (e.g. Technology, Finance, Risk etc,) to deliver quality outcomes Demonstrate a high level of strategic and tactical business acumen and industry knowledge in order to facilitate solution development taking into account expertise in Agile and other related disciplines. Cultivate ”how” to be value-driven and flexible in the way we think and behave – not just “do” such us stand ups  and iterations Implement the Divisional strategy Provide thought leadership to ensure successful design and implementation of delivery strategies that align with business unit, corporate goals and strategies Provide coaching advice to leaders at all levels in analysing business value and delivering well considered solutions Act as a trusted adviser to the business by driving innovative thinking with uncertainty & complex bodies of work Collaborate with other Divisions to ensure long term alignment to enterprise strategy Planning and Monitoring Collaborate with internal business customers and IT departments to ensure engagement and support for strategies Illustrate why Agile is in line with the nature of knowledge work by highlighting day to day inefficiencies that result from applying traditional mind-set to knowledge work Support the business in identification of business benefit and value, tangible and intangible, for initiatives raised. Work with leadership teams to gather business data, perform business analysis and identify key drivers for success Drive efficiencies within DBS through proactive sponsorship of improvement initiatives Balance between the needs of classical project management like answering the question “What will I get, when and for how much “without jeopardising the agility of the project and its ability to welcome change Develop the capability of others through effective mentoring, coaching, professional development Develop a culture that supports team engagement and high performance Deliver Just In Time training on Agile to DBS employees at all levels Develop and deliver Job Instruction Training (using the Tell – Show – Do method) to other Agile practitioners within DBS (including partners) Provide coaching, mentoring and professional development opportunities for those being coached and mentored on Agile WoW Teach organisation to understand the difference between the Agile mindset (“Being Agile) and Agile Practices (“Doing Agile”) and the characteristics needed in individuals, teams and organisations to embrace, promote & manifest the mindset of agility Create a team environment which is seen as an attractive career destination for internal and external candidates Support internal Guilds/Community of Practices Job Duties & Responsibilities Develop and define enterprise business agility roadmap, set the business agility agenda and implementation plan with clear business outcomes, e.g., business value delivery and time to market Define and implement metrics and performance indicators around business agility that will drive the success of the initiative Engage senior management and stakeholders to secure buy-in and support for business agility agenda and participate in forums to propagate and promote business agility Bridge business and technology by building a business agility culture that unifies, manages and resolves conflicts Understand enterprise technology landscape and drive business agility agenda that leverages on tech partnership Provide insight and guidance on enterprise/portfolio/project tech strategy that will support business agility agenda Identify and manage issues and risks, escalate issues as needed, and provide regular progress updates to senior management Required Experience You will have a track-record of establishing the models for commercials, governance, funding, organisational change and underlying delivery organisation, necessary to achieve an effective Agile enterprise; Proven hands on experience working with Agile & Lean Software development practices, and change management are essential i.e. able to do what you teach/coach others; At least  years’ experience in Agile Coaching roles, where you have transformed from traditional ways-of-working, and/ or recovered a troubled Agile transformation at the enterprise level; At least 7 years’ experience in Agile software development methodologies, values, principles and practices; At least 7 years’ experience in coaching, team building and group facilitation At least 7 years’ experience in Scrum, SAFE, DevOps, Kanban, Lean and of Systems Thinking; Strong customer focus: skilled ability to interpret and analyse customer requirements; influence design solutions in-line with Corporate and IT strategy; utilise established internal and external networks to promote innovative solutions for customers; Strong people leadership experience and a proven track record in leading high performing teams; Excellent presentation and written communication skills; Expert relationship management skills; ability to communicate well with diverse stakeholder groups through internal consultation & facilitation; Ability to work independently; Skilled ability to contribute to and understand strategic perspectives, and translate to tactical actions; Flexibility and resilience in responding to multiple changing priorities, and comfortable handling complexity and uncertainty; Systematic and disciplined approach to planning, organising, decision making and delegation; Skilled ability to work in a dynamic leadership team, contributing to the overall goals of the group; Skilled ability to perform synthesis and analysis working at the conceptual level for problem solving. Essential Qualifications: University degree in Business, Information Technology or related discipline (Mandatory) or equivalent industry related experience Certified Scrum Master (CSM) Desired Qualifications: Industry Association or Discipline Association Membership well regarded. ICAgile certification

What the role is The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies. Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering. The Cybersecurity Consultancy Service team in the Cyber Security Group (CSG) in GovTech provides in depth technical Point-of-View of advanced security technologies and emerging technologies to support better use of technologies in Government and the Smart Nation initiatives. What you will be working on Lead in the development and implementation of cloud security architecture and technology to meet business functions while addressing cybersecurity threats and compliance requirements. Involve in the provision of cybersecurity consulting services for large, national or Whole-of-Government projects or systems. Support business initiatives through risk management, which involves performing security risk assessment to identify and analyse security risks, recommending risk treatment and mitigation measures, and assess residual risks. Ensure that key security requirements are defined and designed into the systems, implemented in accordance to the security design, and in compliance with prevailing ICT security policies and standards. Develop and review project specific security specifications and ensure alignment to assessed security risks, security requirements, prevailing ICT security policies and standards. Review security architectures, designs and implementations to ensure compliance with prevailing ICT security policies and standards. Identify design gaps and recommend security enhancements. Involve in designing artefacts (spanning design, development, and implementation) into enterprise systems that aligns to security principles and overall Enterprise System Architecture. Stay abreast of current and emerging cloud security technologies and the associated security threats. Align security architecture frameworks and standards with business strategies and functions. Partner with Ministry/Agency CISO, stakeholders, project teams, and outsourced vendors to ensure security objectives are achieved. What we are looking for Degree in Infocomm Security, Computer Science, Electronics Engineering or equalavant with at least 8 years’ of IT experience in security roles with in-depth hands-on knowledge of security practice. At least 6 years of cloud security architecture experience with a demonstrated ability as a trusted advisor in understanding business needs and security risks. At least 2 years of hands-on experience in one or more of the following security areas: network design, applications development, Internet of Things, wireless communications, cryptography, hardware design protection, mobile management, cloud hosting design and implementation, DevSecOps consulting, design and implementation of CI/CD pipelines, etc. Possess CISSP and/or CCSP, CISM, CISA certifications. Cloud related certifications are of added advantage Knowledge and experience in cloud design and architecture, and security practices/techniques to mitigate cloud security risks. Knowledge and experience of risk management methodologies and risk evaluation techniques. Able to work and communicate with all level from senior management level to working level. Singapore Citizen only. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a comprehensive and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s important for you to keep developing your skill in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round. Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours.

Job_Title: MANAGER / DEPUTY MANAGER, TRANSFORMATION OFFICE (ORGANISATION DEVELOPMENT AND CH
Job_Descriptions: What the role is MANAGER / DEPUTY MANAGER, TRANSFORMATION OFFICE (ORGANISATION DEVELOPMENT AND CHANGE MANAGEMENT) What you will be working on You will be part of a team that drives LTA's transformation to be a people-centred and future-ready organisation, building its capacity for sustainable organisational health and performance. Your role is to facilitate interventions that promote a collaborative and innovative organisational culture, and to support business units in their engagement, alignment, change management, and such transformation needs. You will need to work independently to seek out insights about the organisation and its people, build good networks internally and externally, and be comfortable with project structures requiring tight collaboration across multiple team boundaries. Specifically, you will have a chance to work as a team to: Collect data and deepen organisational health analytics Design and implement broad-based interventions related to engagement and change management Support specific interventions that Groups or Divisions might require Plan and organise organisation-wide engagement platforms Design and implement initiatives for internal communications Experiment and develop new OD tools and resources to support different workstreams What we are looking for Requirements: Tertiary qualification in relevant discipline, e.g. organisational behaviour, psychology, human resource At least 5 years of relevant experience in the areas of organisation development, change management, employee engagement, culture building, strategy alignment, group/team development, organisational learning, design thinking, and so forth Ability to design and conduct interventions at different levels of the system, e.g. facilitating small group conversations, engaging senior leadership teams, and delivering large-group sessions Technical attributes: Systems thinker, resourceful, analytical, and well-versed in various behavioural sciences and approaches Personal attributes: Keen learner with a good sense of self, excellent inter-personal and communication skills to interact with people across all levels of the hierarchy, team player, self-motivated with a positive attitude, and a strong interest to deepen your craft and practice in Organisation Development Having change management (or related) certifications, and a working knowledge of data and analytics, will be an advantage

What the role is We are looking for a Business Analyst who is interested in using data to help HDB design solutions that address its business problems and address the needs of our citizens. Your responsibilities include working with various stakeholders within HDB and with external agencies to identify business problems, develop plans and engage relevant parties to execute both data analytics and digital services projects to drive desired and sustainable solutions for stakeholders. What you will be working on Build strong relationships with stakeholders to understand business challenges and opportunities, scope the problem and turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used for policy making, streamlining operations or developing comprehensive solutions for citizens. Manage end-to-end data projects; identify issues, gather information from various sources, analyse data, interpret patterns and trends, build models, give recommendations and create insightful data visualisation for monitoring outcomes. Review day-to-day operation processes; identify areas of improvement and make actionable recommendations based on underlying analysis. What we are looking for You should possess a background in Business Analytics, or equivalent. You should possess knowledge of how various data are gathered, stored and retrieved. You should have the ability to transform and interpret the data accurately to generate necessary insights as well as be able to present complex information in a friendly manner for end-users to understand. You should be experienced in data modelling, mining, statistics and data analysis, algorithm and able to use statistical software like Python/R, Tableau, SAS Visual Analytics, IBM SPSS modeller and EViews, independently. You should have excellent communication, presentation and writing skills in order to pitch ideas and influence stakeholders. You should possess analytical/logical thinking and enjoy problem solving. You should also be a good team player, able to collaborate with different teams and manage timeline and priorities effectively. All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted for the position within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Job_Descriptions: What the role is SENIOR / EXECUTIVE ENGINEER, ROLLING STOCK AND DEPOT ENGINEERING What you will be working on You will develop rolling stock and depot equipment specifications, and review design submissions from rolling stock manufacturers and depot equipment suppliers. What the role is The Economist Service is the premier service for economists in the Singapore public sector. By developing a core group of professional economists, the objective of the Economist Service is to sharpen economic analysis in the public sector in order to improve public policies. Economists in the Economist Service undertake economic research and analysis in more than 20 Ministries and agencies across the public sector. These include the Ministry of Trade and Industry, Ministry of Finance, Ministry of Manpower, Ministry of Social and Family Development, Ministry of Health, and Ministry of Sustainability and the Environment. Through postings to diverse Ministries and agencies, the economists contribute their expertise to inform a wide range of public policies, from economic policies to fiscal, socio-economic, health, security and infrastructural policies. What you will be working on You are applying to be part of the Economist Service, which is headquartered in the Ministry of Trade and Industry. As a public sector economist, you will shape public policies in Singapore through the application of Economics thinking and the conduct of rigorous economic research and analyses. Through the use of robust data-driven empirical approaches, you will contribute to the base of evidence that supports policy formulation. Your responsibilities include the following areas: (i) Surveillance & Forecasting. Keeping abreast of developments in the global/domestic economy, and analysing the impact of external developments on the domestic economy (e.g., reconfiguration of supply chains). (ii) Economic Research. Investigating topics relevant to public policies (e.g., impact of government policies/schemes on firm/individual-level outcomes). (iii) Policy Analyses. Supporting the planning and implementation of public policies (e.g., evaluating the impact of tourism projects). Economists in the Economist Service generally begin their careers in the Ministry of Trade and Industry’s Economics Division. In the Economics Division, you will be exposed to a diverse range of issues, including economic growth, inflation and business costs, international trade, industrial strategy, corporate landscape and capabilities, labour market, and productivity and innovation. You will also develop expertise in data science-related areas of research and analysis. What we are looking for Degree / Masters / PhD in Economics and other quantitative disciplines such as Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Engineering, or related disciplines. Strong passion for empirical research and extensive experience in solving complex problems using quantitative approaches. Strong quantitative skills (e.g., econometrics and data science) for forecasting, policy modelling and simulations, as well as impact evaluation studies. Excellent communication skills and the ability to express complex ideas simply and logically. Proficiency with statistical/programming software (e.g., STATA, R, Python).

Job_Title: Credit Risk Associate, Traded Credit Risk
Job_Descriptions: The Singapore team is looking for an Associate hire to join their Credit Risk department. Reporting to the Chief Risk Officer, you will be part of a team providing expertise in credit risk management of a distinct portfolio of predominantly APAC financial institutions counterparties (country or sector) to ensure they remain within the bank's appetite and minimise credit losses. You will also be given exposure to provide Traded Credit Risk management support for deal clearance requests from Trading & Sales. Role and responsibilities Build and maintain strong relationships with Trading & Sales acting as an enabler with business partners, seeking to find solutions to proposals Demonstrate sound credit judgement in analysis and approval/decline (if required) as part of the annual review process, new transactions and/or excess approvals, reflecting understanding of pertinent issues and risk drivers and in line with delegated authority Proactively manage the credit risk profile of the APAC credit portfolio and ensure that risks are identified, assessed and mitigated to the desired level Identify problem cases, taking action to mitigate risk and ensuring that the appropriate internal governance is followed Provide expert support and advice to the business on the management of the credit risks in the APAC FI portfolio, including interpreting and complying with the relevant risk policy standards and risk management framework, and sharing relevant information as appropriate, g. regarding changes in risk appetite, emerging trends, potential threats and opportunities. Assist senior credit managers to ensure timely and productive kick-off meetings are held with offshore support teams / analysts. Review financial analysis provided by Credit Analysts; providing constructive feedback and coaching, as appropriate, to ensure required standards are met Participate in client due diligence meetings as appropriate / required Maximise cost effective efficiency through contribution to the change agenda, constructive challenge and improving processes Contribute to the development of a 'team working' ethos, take responsibility for own personal development and pro-actively support the team with development where appropriate Act as cover for the Traded Credit Risk Management function by providing timely and accurate credit figures for live deal clearance to Sales and Trading, including providing or facilitating approvals where required Assist the Excess Management team in analysing credit risk breaches Key requirements Credit risk analysis experience (minimum 2 years experience), preferably covering financial institutions Knowledge of key risks in Traded products (e.g. FX, interest rate swaps, Repo, Options) and associated key documentation terms and agreements used Have the ability to work independently with minimum supervision and exhibiting a positive "can do' attitude and willingness to broaden horizons outside of core credit competency required. This includes embracing the integrated (Credit, Market, Operational Risk & Traded Credit Risk Management) operating model for Risk in APAC Have a take ownership and following up mindset and able to work successfully as part of a team and with senior management Bachelor/Masters degree or equivalent professional qualification. If you are interested in the role and would like to discuss the opportunity further, please click apply now or email Hagen at [email protected] for more information. Only shortlisted candidates will be responded to, therefore if you do not receive a response within 14 days please accept this as notification that you have not been shortlisted.
