What the role is As trustee of the nation’s retirement savings, the Central Provident Fund (CPF) Board helps 4 million CPF members save for their retirement, healthcare and housing needs. Every CPF Ambassador plays a vital role in helping Singaporeans save for a secure retirement. So long as you have the passion and commitment to serve the public, you will find your niche in our big family. What you will be working on Manage a team of staff in managing the daily operations of the CPF Housing Schemes Review and enhance policies, guidelines, systems and processes to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the CPF Housing Schemes Manage appeals, feedback and enquiries related to the Schemes from CPF members and our business partners (e.g., HDB, lawyers) Conduct data analysis to improve policies and operations What we are looking for Effective verbal and written communication skills, as well as good interpersonal and organisational skills Good analytical and numeracy skills. Preferable to have relevant experience in Business Intelligence and data analytics, or proficiency in statistical and data visualisation tools such as SAS, Tableau, R and Python. Meticulous, attentive to details, able to adapt and multi-task in a fast-paced environment to meet tight deadlines Good leadership skills and able to motivate the team to meet the work targets Self-motivated individual who can work both independently and as a team-player, with an interest in technological innovation and/or productivity improvement

Senior Premier Relationship Manager - Wealth & Personal Banking The health and safety of our employees and candidates is very important to us. Due to the current situation related to the Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV), we’re leveraging our digital capabilities to ensure we can continue to recruit top talent at HSBC.  As your application progresses, you may be asked to use one of our digital tools to help you through your recruitment journey.  If so, one of our Resourcing colleagues will explain how our video-interviewing technology will be used throughout the recruitment process and will be on hand to answer any questions you might have. Some careers have more impact than others. If you’re looking for a career where you can make a real impression, join HSBC and discover how valued you’ll be. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further. HSBC Wealth Management leads the Asia-Pacific implementation of our global strategy to deliver world-class solutions to retail and private clients seeking to grow, protect, preserve or transfer their wealth. This involves the development and management of needs-based solutions covering foreign exchange, deposit, investment, insurance and financing products, as well as the provision of suitable market insights and updates, financial planning and advisory services. We are currently seeking a high calibre professional to join our team as a Senior Premier Relationship Manager. Principal Responsibilities Provide premier service and portfolio management to high net worth retail banking clients Embarking on a proactive relationship management to strengthen and deepen relationship with existing customers, hence building a strong foundation for customer growth Understand customers’ banking and financial needs and recommend suitable solutions to meet these needs Demonstrate strong ability to build a portfolio of customers successfully Requirements Proven track record of managing high net worth clients Strong interpersonal relationship skills to be able to work individually as well as to collaborate with stakeholders to meet the needs of these clients Experience in promoting RBWM in a dedicated client relationship role Outgoing disposition, well-equipped with good communication and interpersonal skills Highly driven to excel and be able to thrive within a challenging environment by effectively recognising customers' personal banking and wealth management needs To be considered for this role, the relevant rights to work in Singapore is required. The chosen candidate for this role will be required to undergo enhanced vetting. Subject to local laws, this will require the individual to satisfactorily pass a series of additional checks as part of the recruitment process and on an ongoing basis, if appointed to the role. HSBC Group reserves its position with regards to any steps which it may take in relation to any material adverse findings which arise either when the checks are originally completed, and/or if relevant, on an ongoing basis. For more information about the enhanced vetting for this role, please contact the recruiter for this role. You’ll achieve more when you join HSBC. http://www.hsbc.com/careers HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment. Personal data held by the Bank relating to employment applications will be used in accordance with our Privacy Statement, which is available on our website. Issued by The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited.

Job_Title: School of Applied Science - Research Staff (Insect Biorefinery Process)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is Research Staff (Insect Biorefinery Process) What you will be working on Work with project leader to achieve the aims of the research project on developing an insect biorefinery process. Support project daily activities related to prototype preparation, testing and operation of all related equipment and setup Assist in developing and implementing protocols required for the project Liaise with external collaborator on project development Document, collate, analyse and interpret data Carry out procurement, including liaising with vendors, sourcing for materials, equipment and testing, and raising purchase requests Document and track project issues, expenses and budget tracking, action logs and equipment maintenance Plan experiments and prepare progress reports for regular project updates Provide support in supervising students Perform any other related duties assigned by the project leader and co-project leader What we are looking for Relevant qualifications in Materials Science/ Materials Engineering/ Chemistry or other related fields; preferably with a minimum of 3 years of experience in managing research projects. Experience in handling laboratory equipment and ability to work independently will be preferred. Prior experience with analytical instrumentation, biofuel, and feed formulation will be added advantage. Passion in research with strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to build strong working relationships with people at all levels Possess sound planning, organising and multi-tasking skills, with a strong sense of responsibility for completing assigned duties on time. Proficient in IT skills. Good documentation, research and data analysis skills. Successful candidate will be employed on a contract basis

What the role is The Economist Service is the premier service for economists in the Singapore public sector. By developing a core group of professional economists, the objective of the Economist Service is to sharpen economic analysis in the public sector in order to improve public policies. Economists in the Economist Service undertake economic research and analysis in more than 20 Ministries and agencies across the public sector. These include the Ministry of Trade and Industry, Ministry of Finance, Ministry of Manpower, Ministry of Social and Family Development, Ministry of Health, and Ministry of Sustainability and the Environment. Through postings to diverse Ministries and agencies, the economists contribute their expertise to inform a wide range of public policies, from economic policies to fiscal, socio-economic, health, security and infrastructural policies. What you will be working on You will be part of a team of economists who apply techniques in econometrics, data science and Artificial Intelligence on novel and big datasets in order to address policy questions. Specifically, you will work on data analytics projects covering areas such as trade and internationalisation, labour market and digitalisation, with the objective of extracting data-driven insights to improve policy outcomes and policy formulation. You will also help to enhance economic surveillance capabilities in the Ministry of Trade and Industry through the use of real-time and high-frequency data, as well as predictive modelling. In addition, you will make use of text analytics to actively identify emerging topics from various media sources to be studied by the Economics Division. To effectively engage various stakeholders, you will be required to communicate the insights and findings from your projects in accessible, visual forms such as dashboards. What we are looking for Degree / Masters / PhD in Economics and other quantitative disciplines such as Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Engineering, or related disciplines. Strong passion for empirical research and extensive experience in solving complex problems using quantitative approaches. Strong quantitative skills (e.g., econometrics and data science) for forecasting, policy modelling and simulations, as well as impact evaluation studies. Experience working with large real-time datasets. Excellent communication skills and the ability to express complex ideas simply and logically. Proficiency with statistical/programming software (e.g., STATA, R, Python) and relevant visualisation techniques (e.g., Tableau).

What the role is Your primary role is to assist in the management of the Corporation’s financial investments comprising bonds and externally managed investment portfolios. What you will be working on You will be expected to: Manage the bond portfolio, recommend and execute trades, monitor and report performance; Procure the services of investment advisors, fund managers and related service providers for the externally managed investment portfolios; Assist in the formulation and review of investment policy statement; Conduct due diligence and on-boarding of fund managers; Liaise with fund managers and custodian; Monitor, review and report on the performance of fund managers to ensure that the fund managers comply with their contractual, compliance, fiduciary and investment responsibilities; Scan and analyse market trends and developments, research and propose investment ideas to enhance the risk-adjusted return of the funds; Staff meetings with management, investment committee and Board; Deal with operational matters arising from investments; and Carry out corporate projects and initiatives as assigned. In addition, you will assist in the financial governance of the Corporation’s subsidiaries and any matters requiring corporate finance expertise. What we are looking for Strong background in accounting, business administration, economics, finance, investment management or equivalent Preferably a CFA Charter holder or CFA program candidate Minimum 7 years of relevant working experience Prior experience in managing financial investments (i.e. investment analysis, manager selection) would be advantageous Good interpersonal and communication skills, ability to write well and present with confidence to senior level executives and board members Strong analytical skills, meticulous and proactive A team player, ability to work independently and within a team environment to meet deadlines

What the role is Reporting to the Group Chief Financial Officer, you will oversee the Billing & Collections Dept and Financial Reporting Dept in ensuring the robustness of our financial systems and supporting current activities and future growth for these 2 key areas. Part of the role requires you to put in place effective internal controls and ensure compliance to all statutory requirements, accounting standards and financial regulations. On top of providing effective financial reporting to assist senior management in their decision-making, you are expected to review, update and implement financial policies and procedures. In addition, you will ensure that accounting policies are relevant and accounting estimates are reasonable for the provision of sound financial advice and insights. What you will be working on What we are looking for Background in Accountancy or other relevant professional qualification. A minimum of 12-15 years of relevant financial experience, with at least 6-8 years in a supervisory position. Candidates should have good knowledge of accounting standards and SAP system as well as strong in finance operations. It is essential for candidates to possess good leadership qualities, strong drive for achievements, strong analytical abilities as well as good communication and interpersonal skills.

What the role is As a School Counsellor, your primary role is to work with staff, students, parents, external professionals and community agencies to provide quality school counselling support for students’ mental health, and social-emotional development. What you will be working on Your key roles and responsibilities include: 1. System Support: Developing suitable school counselling programme including a system for needs analysis, early identification and referral of students with mental health issues and social, emotional and behavioural problems Advising school management on school counselling matters Providing consultation as well as planning and conducting training for staff and parents on pertinent mental health issues and skills for first-line intervention and support Networking with relevant external professionals and community agencies Evaluating and reporting to school management on the state of student mental health in the school, and effectiveness of the school counselling programme 2. Preventive Programme: Developing and conducting small and large group psycho-educational sessions for students on mental health issues and healthy coping strategies Developing and/or making available mental health resources for students, parents and staff 3. Responsive Services: Providing individual and group counselling to students Conference with staff, parents and external professionals / agencies on students being counselled, and conduct home visits where necessary Looking into the referral of students and their families to community resources or external professionals where needed Providing direct crisis intervention and follow-up to students affected by critical incidents Maintaining case consultation records and proper documentation Providing regular updates to school management on progress of students being seen for counselling What we are looking for REQUIREMENTS Passion and disposition to work with at-risk students. Empathy for students with social, emotional and mental health difficulties. Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Aware of and sensitive to multicultural issues. Resourceful and resilient. Preferably with at least 1 year of working experience. Experience working or volunteering with children and youths would be an advantage. Applicants should possess a relevant counselling qualification, such as those recognised by the Singapore Association for Counselling (SAC). As applications are processed in batches, applicants can expect to receive an update before the end of the following month. For applicants who are facing issues submitting your application through the [email protected] portal, please contact us at ***************@moe.gov.sg for assistance.

Job_Title: Executive/Senior Executive/Assistant Development Partner, Retail & Design
Job_Descriptions: What the role is What you will be working on Duties and responsibilities include but not restricted to the following: Processing grant applications from a broad base of SMEs which include Verifying company's details to ascertain eligibility Verifying quotations submitted by company are legitimate and according to the cost cap Qualifying the grant and proposing recommendations for support and approvals Handle queries pertaining to various grant schemes, including PSG, MRA, EDG, and other enquires Work with Division to highlight issues and challenges faced while processing applications Division administrative support which include but not restricted to the following: Management and scheduling of meetings for Director/Retail & Design, internal meetings as well as cross-agency and multi-party meetings Work with division officers to collate various reports, including monthly management reports, collation of Division KPIs, Finance and Budget reports. To manage and ensure timely replies from Retail & Design Division generic email Inbox, which includes general enquiries. Support logistics for events as needed, e.g. for Division workplan sessions, external seminars, etc. Other admin duties such as setting up IT access for new officers, maintenance of email filing system and claims, GeBiz matters, etc. What we are looking for You must be independent, meticulous, self-driven and have a strong customer-oriented mindset. At times, you may be required to multitask and manage more than one project concurrently while keeping to the service standards. You should be proficient in MS Office. Candidates with experience in external customer-facing roles and good written and verbal communication skills would have an advantage.

Job_Title: Development Partner / Senior Development Partner, Heartland Enterprise
Job_Descriptions: What the role is What you will be working on You will be tasked to enable and support the upgrading of businesses in the heartlands, especially in the areas of productivity and digitalisation. You will also work closely with the Heartland Enterprise Centre, Singapore (HECS) as well as trade and business/merchants' associations, HDB, IMDA and other private and public organisations to uplift the capabilities of heartland enterprises by designing and executing suitable programmes. This will include developing and executing initiatives on scaling e-payments, e-commerce and training programmes to heartland enterprises. At the same time, you will be expected to process and evaluate grant applications submitted by enterprises from the heartland industries. What we are looking for Driven, energetic, and highly-motivated who is equipped with good analytical, partnership management, networking and communication (written & spoken) skills. Candidates with 2-3 years of relevant working experience with SMEs or heartland enterprises would be preferred. If you are shortlisted for the position, you may be required to complete a preliminary online interview and written assessment. Successful candidates will be shortlisted for further interview.

What the role is What you will be working on What we are looking for Competencies have long been used as a framework to help focus employees' behaviour on things that matter most and help us drive success. We are looking for candidates with the following competencies:

Associate/Analyst, Operations, Secured Credit, Consumer Banking Ops, Technology & Operations - (WD29611) Business Function Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels Key Accountabilities Learn and perform key processes within Auto Loan Origination efficiently Technical Verification checks - understanding process of loan application and approval. Obtain knowledge on regulation and bank internal guideline for secured auto loan Pre-Disbursement checks - documentation checks before bank disburse the approved loan to our business partners - car dealers Participation in auto loan project and initiatives, including testing, development and maintenance of new and existing systems Job Duties & Responsibilities Perform Technical Verification function for Auto Loan Applications, checking & verifying customers' income documentation proof, compliance with relevant regulations and other necessary requirements within specified performance standards in turnaround time and accuracy as determined by the Bank Perform checks on the accuracy of data entry in the Bank's systems including derivation of Income & other amounts necessary for the Loan Application Work closely with our business partners and be able to communicate with all of them to ensure full and proper submission of all necessary documents, KYC & other supporting documents or information necessary for each Loan Application To perform the checking/verification of all documents & other necessary functions, etc. in the processing of auto loan applications for pre-disbursement within specified standards of quality and turnaround time. Conduct necessary searches to ensure that all newly pledged vehicles are still under registration & that used cars proposed as securities are not under any financing or encumbrance(s) To perform post-disbursement functions in relation to Auto Loans Perform UAT and analytic review for system linkage/enhancements/logic validation to ensure successful implementation. Required Experience 2 years minimum experience, preferably in Ops Strong presentation skills, knowledge of data analytics and project management would be a plus Sound understanding of Financial Services, knowledge in car financing and the relevant banking regulations Proficiency with MS Office applications, particularly Excel Meticulous and detailed oriented, organized with good problem-solving skills Hard-working, self-motivated and a strong team player who takes initiative Good interpersonal and communication skills Capable to work effectively under pressure and minimum supervision Team player Able to work overtime if required Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Relationship Manager, Global Commodities Finance Description Manage a portfolio of international clients in the commodity finance sector Collaborate with various department across the bank in identifying possible cross selling opportunities Monitor developments in the commodities space and appraise potential business opportunities Support the end-to-end transaction process, such as the preparing of detailed credited proposal, review relevant KYC reports, loan documents, conduct thorough risk reports and annual reviews. *LI-AL Qualifications Skills and Experience Required Familiar in the trade and commodity finance field Min 3-5 years client management experience, ideally in corporate, multinational groups and Financial Institutions Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Strong analytical and research skills Growth mindset with interest in digitalisation and sustainability development.

Job_Title: Associate, Data Analyst, Consumer Banking Group - (WD27326)
Job_Descriptions: Business Function As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business - they were made just right for you. Responsibilities The Data analyst will be involved in providing ad hoc analysis, insights, and building and maintaining machine learning solutions. Should have ability to use different analytics tools and platforms like SAS, SQL, Python, R. etc. Data analyst with basic proficiency in statistical analysis, data mining, machine learning and working with large scale datasets. Build and deliver on the Regional Control Tower toolset Requirements B.S. or Masters or equivalent degree in Statistics, Analytics, Applied Mathematics, Operation Research, or equivalent quantitative fields preferred. Strong mathematical and statistics background. 0-3 years of experience in industry (ideally ecommerce, technology, consumer banking, telecoms, retail) and/or academia with demonstrated track record of innovative research and insight generation and implementation of insights into tools/processes delivering front end business results. Should have a basic understanding of using data mining, machine learning techniques and recommendation Engines on large amount of data, building and implementing various statistical models. Good written and oral communication skills. Key skill sets required Statistical Programming Tool Skills : Programming experience in SAS (Base, Stats, Macro, EG, EM), R, Python, Spark or other statistical programming software. Platform and Database skills : Familiarity with Hadoop, Hive. Proficient in using databases like Teradata, Oracle, SQL Server, etc. Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Compliance Specialist - AML Policy, Strategy & Governance (1 Year Contract) At Bank of Singapore, we are constantly on the lookout for exceptional individuals to join our team. We promote a culture of openness, teamwork and fairness. Most importantly, we invest in our people through our programmes that develop them on both professional and personal levels. Besides attractive remuneration packages, we offer non-financial benefits and opportunities to develop your potential within OCBC Group’s global network of subsidiaries and offices. If you have passion, drive and the will to succeed, rise to the challenge today! GENERAL DESCRIPTION As a key member of the AML Compliance policy team, he/she will be in-charge of the review of AML/CFT policies and procedures, monitoring of regulatory developments and conducting training programmes to uplift the bank's AML/CFT controls effectiveness. MAIN DUTIES Main roles and responsibilities include: Strengthen AML/CFT policies and procedures and implement effective controls measures together with relevant internal stakeholders to comply with regulatory requirements relevant to the business and operating environment. Review policies and procedures regularly, taking into consideration emerging risks and new money laundering/terrorism financing (ML/TF) typologies observed. Actively monitor regulatory developments in Singapore and other jurisdictions in which the Bank operates in; and keep abreast of regulatory expectations and industry best practices. Perform impact and gap analysis in a timely manner before proposing sound recommendations and action plans to address the self-identified gaps. Prepare training materials and deliver effective training on revised policies and procedures and case studies/typologies (including lessons learnt from other financial institutions' AML/CFT controls failures). Contribute to ongoing efforts to enhance reporting of ML/TF/sanctions risks and AML/CFT controls effectiveness to Board and Senior Management. Qualifications Work Experience and Technical Skills Degree with minimum 2 years of direct and broad-based compliance experience in the field of AML/CFT and sanctions. Strong technical knowledge and understanding of regulatory requirements on AML/CFT and sanctions in the context of private banking. Strong understanding and active awareness of regulatory expectations in Singapore, international developments, emerging risks/typologies and global trends in relation AMLCFT and Sanctions. Strong analytical capabilities and risk acumen to review management reporting information, with added edge in ability to embrace new technology or have data analytics/coding skills. Passionate and finds purpose in pursuing a career in the field of AML/CFT and Sanctions. Good team player and interpersonal skills to allow effective collaboration with multiple stakeholders in BOS/OCBC Group and able to work with BOS colleagues from different cultures and countries. Possesses both high-level strategic outlook and ability to delve into details to drive implementation of key projects, timelines and initiatives. Strong written and oral communication skills and ability to interact effectively with people at different levels. Bachelor Degree

What the role is The Communications and Engagement Group (CEG) in MOE works towards strengthening public trust in the education system by informing and connecting with its stakeholders to achieve positive educational outcomes. As an Officer/ Senior Officer, Media Relations with the Communications Division under the CEG, you will be part of a dynamic team that promotes effective communication of education policies and programmes to enhance the understanding of Singapore’s education system. What you will be working on Provide strategic advice on communication of policies and programmes, and develop integrated plans for key events and announcements Advise MOE Statutory Boards, Institutes of Higher Learning and/or schools on communication-related matters Analyse media reports on education issues and manage media requests Prepare communication materials such as speeches, press releases, information sheets, media pitches and social media posts We welcome individuals with or without prior work experience in communications and media to apply for the position. What we are looking for Keen interest and strong awareness of current affairs Strong analytical, writing and communication skills, preferably bilingual Able to work well independently and in teams In general, applicants can expect to hear from us within 4 weeks of the close of the application window. In the event where we receive a high number of applications, applicants will receive an update on their status within 6 weeks of the close of the window. Job_Title: Business Implementation Manager - Global Transaction Services (GTS) - WD29597
Job_Descriptions: Business Implementation Manager - Global Transaction Services (GTS) - (WD29597) Business Function Global Transaction Services (GTS) comprises of Cash & Trade, Securities Services and Fiduciary Services. In an increasingly borderless world marked by burgeoning trade flow, expertise in trade finance services is an invaluable asset. With cash the lifeblood of every company, so too, is a good understanding of how to manage these cashflows. Trade Finance, together with Cash Management, is the mainstay of GTS, and is extended to SME and corporate clients for their local and cross-border financial transaction needs. Job Purpose The implementation manager is required to manage and lead clients in the end to end implementation of GTS products, and to ensure that the GTS solution is successfully and seamlessly delivered. Key Accountabilities Lead and manage the end to end Implementation of GTS solutions (Cash Management, Trade Finance, Supply Chain) in a consistent and timely manner Be the single point of contact to client throughout the implementation process and coordinate the implementation activities internally with various stakeholders (Sales, RM, Product, Legal, Operations, Technology) Adopt a consultative approach in understanding client’s As-Is state and map out the necessary tasks required for a smooth transition / implementation journey Manage escalations and resolve project issues effectively and in a timely manner Conduct post implementation surveys / reviews Participate in Sales / RFP opportunities Job Duties and Responsibilities Lead and manage the end to end Implementation process in a consistent and timely manner, coordinate the following activities with clients and internal stakeholders: Project Planning Documentation System testing and setups Production deployment Live verification Handover to Business Care Manage Project Timeline effectively through Regular project reporting to ensure milestones are met on time Prompt resolution of issues Perform file testing and training for clients integrating with IDEAL eBanking Proactively engage and support the client to achieve greater client satisfaction in the overall implementation process. Experience Non-Technical Experience At least 5 years of relevant experience Strong Project Management skills Good knowledge and understanding of GTS products (Cash Management / Trade Finance / Supply Chain Financing) would be of advantage Effective and concise communicator, both verbal and written, ability to interact with stakeholders of different levels of seniority Customer orientated, ability to anticipate client needs, demonstrates initiative and pro-activeness Willingness to learn Ability to adapt to a changing environment Excellent team player with strong interpersonal skills Post Graduate Degree is preferred Technical Experience General knowledge of client’s ERP systems. In-depth technical knowledge is not required.

Job_Descriptions: What the role is As a Manager/ Senior Manager, Innovation & Transformation in the HR Strategy and Leadership Division, you will build up the innovation and organisation development capabilities in MOE officers as well as drive MOE’s efforts in the Public Sector Transformation (PST) initiative. You will also be guiding and supporting change management efforts. Job_Title: Development Partner / Senior Development Partner, Spore-India Partnership Office
Job_Descriptions: What the role is What you will be working on You will join the Singapore-India Partnership Office (SIPO) team on its mission to strengthen and diversify Singapore's economic relations with India. Based in Singapore, you will help Singapore companies to enter into India, navigate through regulatory frameworks and business norms, and establish strategic contacts with overseas counterparts. You will closely engage with India and Singapore's officials, India's local business houses, identify key growth industries, develop strategies and projects to help Singapore companies establish a niche in India. To thrive as a member of our team, you welcome the challenge of working in a complex and dynamic environment, and be flexible in responding to ambiguity and uncertainty. You enjoy opportunities to initiate and facilitate the execution of projects across many different sectors with partners in Singapore and India. What we are looking for Besides being independent, tenacious and resilient and resourceful, you should also possess good business acumen and strong analytical skills. Excellent communication skills, including writing and presentation, is required. You should have a degree, preferably with at least 3 years of working experience in areas such as business development/consulting. Relevant experience working with the Singapore public sector and/or emerging markets, particularly India, is an advantage.

What the role is What you will be working on You will help develop and execute policies relating to the Food Services industry that comprises subsectors like restaurants, cafes, kiosks, fast food and coffeeshops. You will account manage food services enterprises - working with them on their growth plans and strategies; identify and recommend assistance for capabilities building (eg digitalisation, new business models), and facilitate internationalisation through our network of overseas centres. In addition, you will work with partners to develop and deliver these policies and programmes. You will be involved in project management and promoting the adoption of best practices for the industry. What we are looking for Possess 2 to 3 years of working experience; former experience in the food industry, or in a Public Sector or consultancy role is a bonus. The candidate should be results-oriented, with good analytical skills, as well as strong account management, networking and communication skills. Job_Title: MGR/AVP, Business Continuity Manager, Group Risk Management - (210002J1)
Job_Descriptions: OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. It is now the second largest financial services group in Southeast Asia by assets and one of the world’s most highly-rated banks, with an Aa1 rating from Moody’s. Recognised for its financial strength and stability, OCBC Bank is consistently ranked among the World’s Top 50 Safest Banks by Global Finance and has been named Best Managed Bank in Singapore by The Asian Banker. Division Description Group Risk Management (GRM) is an independent function responsible for ensuring that risk management practices at OCBC Bank are effective and comprehensive. GRM builds and drives the Bank's businesses through an integrated risk management approach relying on strong risk analytics to support strategic business decision-making and to create a competitive edge for the Group. Job Summary The Business Continuity Manager works with a team of Business Continuity Management (BCM) professionals in the management of the Group BCM program.  The BCM Manager will work with various business units and subsidiaries in the Group to ensure the currency of business continuity planning, training, testing and attestation.  The incumbent will also be a key member during incidents and crisis events, working closely with the various incident response team in the formulation of appropriate responses, mitigation of impact arising from such contingencies and providing support to the Crisis Management Team. Key Responsibilities: Execute and monitor the progress of the Group BCM program; Provide internal consultative advisory services to business units on all BCM matters; Liaise with external parties in ensuring the adequacy of recovery plans of key service providers when necessary; Support all BCM-lead initiatives such as risk assessments, industry-wide exercises, joint exercises; Coordinate and conduct business recovery exercises to validate the recovery strategies of business units on a regular basis; Manage and maintain recovery resources and equipment; Develop and conduct trainings on all aspects of BCM to employees with BCM responsibilities and general staff to raise BCM awareness; Work as part of the Corporate Security team to provide 24/7 on-call support when necessary Qualifications The ideal Candidate will meet the following requirements: Minimum 5 years’ experience in a BCM or related role, preferably in a financial institution; Excellent collaboration and interpersonal skills with the ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships at all levels; Able to prioritize, plan and multi-task in a fast-paced collaborative team environment and organize activities systematically; Able to work independently; Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; Excellent oral/written communication and presentation skills; High degree of proficiency in Microsoft applications (i.e. Excel, Word, PowerPoint). Good understanding of industrial BCM standards and relevant local regulatory requirements for the Group’s operating locations; Demonstrable knowledge of banking operations and processes; BCM certification by a recognised BCM institution (i.e. BCI, DRI); and Experience with crisis/incident management. Desired but not essential: Good understanding of industrial BCM standards and relevant local regulatory requirements for the Group’s operating locations; Demonstrable knowledge of banking operations and processes; BCM certification by a recognised BCM institution (i.e. BCI, DRI); and Experience with crisis/incident management. At OCBC, we recognise your drive, passion and talent. We will bring out the best in you and empower you to excel. Fulfil your life goals and career ambitions with us. *We regret that only shortlisted Candidates will be notified.

Job_Title: Senior Associate/AVP, UX Researcher, Consumer Banking Group - (WD29433)
Job_Descriptions: Senior Associate/AVP, UX Researcher, Consumer Banking Group, Group Design - (WD29433) Business Function As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business – they were made just right for you. About the design team Hi, we are the DBS user experience design team We create digital products that deserve to be built because they solve real problems in an impactful way with empathy. How we design We go beyond numbers Every dollar means something. No one actually wants money. We want what it can give us. So we acknowledge that money is not really about money. We inject emotion into our products to go from transactional to magical. We have one profound idea Because ambiguity is the enemy of good user experience. What is our unique value proposition? Would adding another feature dilute the idea or make it stronger? What you'll be doing You will keep us on our toes. Remind us to look away from the comfort of our screens and back at the reality—where our customers live. You will keep asking, 'Why are we doing this again?'. And not be satisfied with the answer, 'If we build it, they will come.' Here's what your week might look like Not everything has to be tested. You will identify when research is required and when best practices are the way to go. And you will help us communicate that to our stakeholders. You will do the groundwork: qualitative and quantitative research. We've done some interesting stuff: diary studies, ethnography, A/B testing, and others. In short, we love to experiment and hope you will join in. Once you've done the research, you'll create sharp and concise reports full of actionable findings. Your reports will be things of beauty that will inspire your colleagues to truly start seeing through the eyes of our customers. UX is a pretty established discipline here at DBS, but we can always use help to evangelise the importance of good UX Research, and how, just because it has the word 'research' in it, it doesn't take months! Here are the experience and skills we'd love you to have You have 2 to 5 years of relevant experience. You've had hands-on involvement with an end-to-end research process. You have a working knowledge of qualitative and quantitative data analyses, usability testing, eye tracking, card sorting, survey evaluation, A/B and multivariate testing and heuristic evaluations. You can filter out noise to uncover actionable insights. In our experience, people who are organised, methodical and analytical are very good at this. You are an eloquent public speaker and an accomplished report-writer. You are an empathic human being with interest in psychology, anthropology, human-computer interaction, cognitive science and business. Bonus points You have experience in the fintech industry. Job_Title: Senior Engineer / Engineer (Sustainability, R&D) – 2 year contract
Job_Descriptions: What the role is As the main industrial master planner in Singapore, JTC recognises its significant role in the built environment and the importance of imbuing sustainability across its business value chain to accelerate its journey towards decarbonisation. JTC’s Sustainability Department/Office is responsible for developing and advancing JTC’s green strategy, by providing strategic advice, setting targets and tracking the sustainability performance of JTC’s initiatives across the value chain of its business. It also promotes sustainability awareness both internally and externally, support communications in shaping narratives, identify new decarbonisation opportunities and sustainability initiatives to be integrated into our design and planning, constructions, operations, customer and community engagement efforts. At JTC, we pioneer cutting-edge technologies that deliver the cleanest, safest and most competitive solutions to our built assets’ vital needs. We embrace the power of innovation and technology as an enabler to accelerate our sustainability journey. JTC’s Sustainability Department/Office serves the R&D arm of JTC by developing the portfolio of sustainability R&D projects necessary for enhancing the sustainability and resilience of our built infrastructure. You will be a part of a strategic, dynamic, independent team to formulate sustainability strategies that are aligned with whole-of-government and our national goals (SG Green Plan), identify sustainability related solutions, work with other agencies and internal/external stakeholders to formulate internal/external policies, initiatives, programs and projects to drive sustainability and decarbonization efforts. In addition, you will be an integrator to coordinate and integrate across various divisions’ and our customers’ initiatives. Join us in this unique opportunity to create real impact in a sector traditionally known for its relatively high carbon footprint and be part of the game-changer. What you will be working on - To support the formulation and execution of JTC Green’s strategy, which charts the decarbonisation strategies and pathways for JTC across its value chain. - To integrate, measure and track JTC’s sustainability and decarbonisation initiatives across the its value chain from planning and design, construction, operations and industry. - Manage sustainability R&D projects and develop the portfolio in relevant green topics such cooling technologies, smart building controls, green materials etc. - To interface and liaise with various inter-agencies collaborations, studies, discussions on climate change, green growth, carbon accounting and environmental sustainability What we are looking for Knowledge in Environmental Engineering/Design and Architecture/Environmental Sciences/Environmental Management/Biodiversity, Conservation and Nature-based Climate Solutions/Energy Policy and Climate Change Adaptation/Mitigation would be preferred. Candidates who had completed relevant modules in sustainability-related courses will also be considered. Minimum 5 years of working experience in a similar capacity with experience in handling sustainability/ decarbonization-related initiatives, climate policy and/or ESG, sustainability reporting and carbon accounting. Candidates with BCA’s Singapore Green Mark certification and involvement in low carbon/net zero emission initiatives (eg: zero energy, super-low energy buildings) will have an added advantage. Interest and knowledge in low-carbon technologies (e.g. CCUS), carbon services (e.g. carbon credit), climate change infrastructure (e.g. coastal protection strategies for sea level rise), coastal engineering/management will be useful. Excellent written and oral communication skills in English. Able to work in a fast-paced environment, thoughtful, committed, and flexible. Strong analytical, interpersonal and communication skills.

Incident Response & Management Job Summary Singapore Permanent BBBH796084 Nov 03, 2021 Competitive Job Description One of the world's leading banks is looking for an Incident Manager will be required to take charge of Information Security events . Incident Response & Management Manager, Global Information Security Position Summary: Incident Management is part of the Response and Recovery whose aim is to respond to an incident in the manner that will reduce the impact and risk to the organization as much as possible. The Incident Manager will be required to take charge of Information Security events and incidents as they occur and co-ordinate and work collaboratively with colleagues across the business to resolution. Responsibilities: Establish oversight of information security events and incidents and communicate analysis, containment and remediation efforts to all business partners. Incident response and recovery plans will be available to use and should be maintained by the team. Any issues that require management escalation will be expected to be completed in a timely manner including all appropriate information in relation to risk and action times. The Incident Manager will be expected to provide status updates and post-incident reports for executives and stakeholders in non-technical terms encompassing risk, impact, likelihood, containment and remediation activities and threat actors. Risk management including briefing and recommending actions to executive leadership within Global Information Security and other business partners on events and incidents The incident manager will be part of a global 24/7 rotation and there is a requirement to work 8-10 weekends per year on an on-call basis as a primary contact and 8-10 weekends as a secondary contact. There will also be a requirement to cover the majority of US holidays. Requirements: Proven experience handling Information Security related events and incidents Experience in an operations focused role with an emphasis on incident response Demonstrable experience in the coordination of containment activities related to cyber security incidents Familiarity with security vulnerabilities exploits and APT tools, techniques and procedures Familiarity with network security vulnerabilities, exploits, malware and digital forensics desirable An excellent communicator who can adapt to their audience Decisive and can make difficult decisions in what can be a high pressure environment Exercise independent judgment in methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results Able to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment and take action without causing an undue delay Supportive and can work well as part of a team as well as independently Ability to remain calm under pressure Ability to work in a strong team-orientated environment with a sense of urgency and resilience Must be able to think outside the box and develop solutions to accomplish seemingly impossible tasks whilst remaining risk and objective focused If you are interested in this position, please click "Apply Now" and we will review your qualifications & reach out to you for further discussion & next steps, if your skillsets meet the needs of the role. Only shortlisted candidates will be responded to, therefore if you do not receive a response within 14 days please accept this as notification that you have not been shortlisted. Job_Title: Global Transaction Services Techno Senior Business  …
Job_Descriptions: Global Transaction Services Techno Senior Business Analyst The role will be part of the Global Transaction Services Technology (GTST) APAC team. GTST is a technology service delivery organization supporting the Global Banking and Markets business in Asia Pacific. The Bank is embarking on a multi-year core banking transformation journey to replace its legacy core banking platform with modern technology platforms. As part of the core banking platform transformation, the bank will seek opportunities to revamp & improve its end to end ecosystem to improve operational & technological efficiency. The core banking platforms support multiple functions in Global Banking and Markets business: e.g. payments, deposits, credit, trade finance, foreign exchange, general ledger. The candidate will be a senior product and techno-functional expert, and will play a leadership role in the banking transformation program. He/She will work with product teams, technical leads, and vendor SMEs for a given work stream (e.g. payments, trade finance) under the core banking transformation program and will have direct accountability in ensuring that business requirements for the work stream are designed and implemented as per expectation. The role is expected to build a deep understanding of the core banking platform and the capability it offers, and play a leadership role in solution ideation, design, and delivery. The role is required to work closely with business, operations, vendor partners and various peer groups/stakeholders in technology. The Position: Work with business, operations, and technology teams to gather requirements and recommend the optimal way to implement the solution in the product. Organize/Facilitate vendor demos to evaluate tools and solutions that may be adopted. Provide leadership and guidance on functional and technical aspects of the solution. Leverage domain and product expertise to set direction and drive project execution. Foresee and proactively address risks, issues, and dependencies. Act as the liaison between vendor and internal teams on requirements and oversee their end-to-end implementation. Manage user queries during feature implementation, and ensure that they are tracked and closed. Participate in system design, SIT, and UAT to ensure that solutions are being delivered and tested as per requirements. Ensure knowledge sharing and training on new product features. Recommend and implement data migration and integration strategies. Develop the Day-1 Operating model and support its implementation post go live. The Candidate: Essential Skills (Technical / Business Domain / Managerial/ Soft skills) Sound knowledge of the Wholesale Banking domain: e.g. deposits, payments, receivables, liquidity management, trade finance, commercial loans, credit management, FX. Experience in Core Banking transformation, and in designing core banking solutions that fit into a complex product ecosystem. Experience working with product and service vendors, and with the onshore-offshore delivery model. Ability to drive senior level discussions with good presentation and communication skills. Ability to influence & work with regional and global partners/stakeholders to drive the program forward. Execution and result oriented. Aptitude for critical thinking, problem solving, and decision-making. Desired Skills (Technical / Domain / Managerial/ Language Skills) Finacle implementation expertise. Knowledge of Finacle Core modules and the Finacle data model. Knowledge of Finacle Scripting and Finacle Workflows. Familiarity with Asia Banking market practices For more information you can email Duncan Gage in our Singapore office on Duncan.gage@teksystems.com quoting Job Reference 523619 or alternatively, apply here to register your interest. http://jobs.en-sg.teksystems.com/96S9x4/global-transaction-services-techno-senior-business-analyst-itcommunications-singapore-singapore-14463422 Allegis Group Singapore Pte Ltd, Company Reg No. 200909448N, EA Licence No. 10C4544

Job_Title: VP/AVP, Climate Risk Stress Testing Specialist,  …
Job_Descriptions: VP/AVP, Climate Risk Stress Testing Specialist, Risk Management Group Business Function Risk Management Group works closely with our business partners to manage the bank's risk exposure by balancing its objective to maximise returns against an acceptable risk profile. We partner with origination teams to provide financing, investments and hedging opportunities to our customers. To manage risk effectively and run a successful business, we invest significantly in our people and infrastructure. The team is responsible for regulatory & portfolio stress testing and general provisioning under IFRS9, including model development, execution, reporting and stakeholder management. This strategically critical role will assume ownership of the execution of Climate Risk stress tests, with a focus on expected credit losses and capital demand. Responsibilities Assess industry practices and regulatory expectations to contribute to the development of in-house climate risk stress testing capabilities and approaches covering transition / physical risks Conduct assessment of climate risk scenarios, focusing primarily on the execution of stress tests and translation of climate risk scenarios/ macroeconomic forecasts to credit risk projections Generation of IFRS 9 ECLs (GP and SP), NPAs and/or regulatory credit risk capital demand (RWA and EL) projections across the entire Group's credit portfolio in head office, branches, and subsidiaries. Generate reports for climate risk stress tests, including committee submissions and regulatory templates Conduct in depth analysis / deep dives of climate risk stress test results to identify and explain trends Coordinate and work across key stakeholders in IRB modelling, risk data, risk architecture and technology teams to develop and mange end-to-end stress testing processes Collaborate with locations to support the delivery of supervisory climate risk stress testing exercises as they emerge Explore and experiment with alternative modelling approaches for climate risk stress testing, including modification of existing stress testing models and approaches Support other internal and regulatory stress testing exercises Make active contributions to improving existing stress testing processes Requirements Prior engagement in climate-related workstreams and other risk areas strongly desired Hands-on experience with stress testing or IFRS 9 ECL preferred, particularly climate risk stress testing Solid understanding of Basel, MAS and HKMA supervisory requirements, including increasing expectations on climate risk stress testing Understanding of Basel IRB models, Stress Testing and/ or IFRS9 models and approaches Knowledge of credit process and business products Excellent programming skills in SAS, Python, Spark, R or other advanced languages; experience working with large and complex datasets Strong team player with good stakeholder management skills Excellent level of verbal communication, writing and presentation skills University graduate or post-graduate with major in Finance, Statistics, or other quantitative discipline Minimum 5-7 years of relevant experience in areas described above Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Who are we looking for: We are looking for an Account Manager who will play a vital part in contributing to our long-term profitability. You will also own and drive the growth strategies for your named accounts and contribute to the continuous improvement of Hubble's account management process. We will not be successful unless our customers are receiving massive value from our service. You will own driving success for our customers. This role includes responsibilities for account management activities (e.g., planning, adoption, advocacy, retention, etc.) and outcomes (e.g., renewals, up-sell, etc.). What Hubble will give you: Hubble is built by a team of talented, driven, and ambitious individuals. We do not subscribe to conventions. AVP/Senior Associate, Data Science Analyst, Consumer Banking Operations, Technology & Operations - (WD24079) Business Function Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels. Job Purpose As a Data Science Analyst for Consumer Banking Operations, you will help to design and build scalable analytics solutions through data pipelines, and visualize datasets that empower consumer banking business with actionable analytics in our most strategic transformation. In this complex role, you are expected to be able to perform in multiple roles seamlessly as required viz. Business Analyst, Solution Designer, Developer and Data Scientist. Responsibilities Gather, document user requirements, perform exploratory data analysis to understand customer struggles in the journey and create actionable insights through journey analytics Access and integrate data from multiple sources Create analytical deep-dives using advanced statistical methods to understand the primary drivers behind customer struggles Derive business relevant insights within a horizontal organization (working with multiple stakeholders)/Able to understand and solve the business problem by translating into a data model and building insights into an actionable outcome Design, develop, test and deploy end to end analytics solutions and models (both data pipeline and visualization) As for visualizations, be able to design user friendly and data efficient outputs in various forms (from operational reports to dashboards aimed at non-analytics users and senior management) Support full lifecycle of experimentation (A/B testing) through journey analytics and machine learning driven insights/Analyze experiment results and identify opportunities for improving experiment uplift; propose new experiment iterations based on the insights from the data Work with cross-functional teams and able to execute well in a fast-paced and agile environment Be a self-starter and must exhibit full sense of ownership of the platform you work on Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information System, Statistics, Engineering, Data Science or related disciplines Minimum 6 years of relevant work experience in a similar role Excellent hands-on experience in Python, Pyspark, Spark, SQL/mysql (including query optimization) Hadoop eco-system (Hive, HDFS, Pig etc.) and relational databases End to end data science workflow, starting from data extraction, wrangling, modelling and deployment in production environment Software development, exposure to full development life cycle from requirements gathering to production support Experience creating real time and rich data visualizations that involves large datasets Experience manipulating structured and unstructured data sources for analysis A good understanding of machine learning, NLP concepts Excellent problem solving skills, able to work independently with minimal guidance in a cross-functional context/Able to pick up new methods and techniques quickly and apply towards solving a problem at hand Attracted to a fast paced, hypothesis and test driven, collaborative and iterative environment Detail-oriented with strong organizational, analytical and communication skills, team player Proven ability to roll up your sleeves and contribute quickly Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Job_Title: AVP, UX Researcher, Institutional Banking Group, Group Design - (WD18855)
Job_Descriptions: Business Function As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business – they were made just right for you. What you'll be doing You will keep us on our toes. Remind us to look away from the comfort of our screens and back at the reality—where our customers live. You will keep asking, 'Why are we doing this again?'. And not be satisfied with the answer, 'If we build it, they will come.' Here's what your week might look like Not everything has to be tested. You will identify when research is required and when best practices are the way to go. And you will help us communicate that to our stakeholders. You will do the groundwork: qualitative and quantitative research. We've done some interesting stuff: diary study (we got people to log all their payments and write about each), Ethnography (observe how small merchants are coping with digital payments) and others. In short, we love to experiment and hope you will join in. Once you've done the research, you'll create sharp and concise reports full of actionable findings. Your reports will be things of beauty that will inspire your colleagues to truly start seeing through the eyes of our customers. UX is a pretty established discipline here at DBS (thanks to one person especially), but we can always use help to evangelise the importance of good UX Research, and how, just because it has the word 'research' in it, it doesn't take months! Here are the experience and skills we'd love you to have You have 5 to 8 years of relevant experience. You've had hands-on involvement with an end-to-end research process. You have a working knowledge of qualitative and quantitative data analyses, usability testing, eye tracking, card sorting, survey evaluation, A/B and multivariate testing and heuristic evaluations. You can filter out noise to uncover actionable insights. In our experience, people who are organised, methodical and analytical are very good at this. You are an eloquent public speaker and an accomplished report-writer. You are an empathic human being with interest in psychology, anthropology, human-computer interaction, cognitive science and business. Bonus points You have experience in the fintech industry. You have service design experience. You've been a designer yourself (or have some design experience). We find that it really helps when working with designers. You are a 'best practice junkie' and have a treasure trove of usability research around the best design pattern to use. You're kind of a behavioural science geek. Your team and career You will belong to two families: the Institutional Banking Group UX Design team and Research & Insights team. You will report to the IBG research lead, and work very closely with people from Research & Insights. You will own user research for one of IBGs key products.

Job_Title: Group Facilities Management (FM) - Mechanical Trade Team Lead
Job_Descriptions: Job Description : Basic purpose of the position* The incumbent is responsible for leading Mechanical Trade Site Team and supporting the Site Lead, Group FM in the management of specialist vendors and maintenance agent to create and sustain a safe and healing hospital environment for patients, staff and general public. Strong culture of staff and leadership accountability To work closely with Head, Group FM and Site Lead, Group FM in building clear accountability, expectations and deliverables for the Site Mechanical Trade team. To take responsibility for good contract management wrt Mechanical systems with clear end-to-end expectations on contract management. which include the Pre-signing responsibilities of the Contract Owners, and the post-signing responsibilities which broadly covers Contract Monitoring (e.g. Service level monitoring), Escalation of Contract Errors, Non-Compliances, Claims and Disputes, Legal Disputes, Contract Review (e.g. Supplier performance assessment, Exercising of option years etc.) and Retention. These will be part of the annual total performance management (TPM) review. Ensure mechanical team members are aware of their accountability for service performance or lapses. Lead the Mechanical Trade Site Team in facilities operations such as system breakdown investigations, inspections, audits, review of maintenance program, etc. To oversee and guide the specialist vendors and maintenance agent to meet their KPIs to ensure consistent performance. Contract drafting, evaluation, negotiation, and execution To work with Contract Management Team oversee and monitor the performance of specialist vendors wrt the awarded contracts e.g. Pneumatic Tube System, Fire Protection System, etc. Be familiar and ensure compliance with NUHS Contract Management Policy and Processes, NUHS Procurement Policy and Audit Compliance. Serve as a subject matter expert and provide guidance on contract matters to project managers or other operational staff. Maintaining contractual & authorities records as well as communication to stakeholders To work with FM Admin team in keeping proper records of all contract documents (agreement, checklist, etc) to ensure full compliance and to mitigates risk by serving as an audit trail and evidence that is easily accessible. To respond and provide necessary documentations to Authorities when required and as necessary. Developing and implementing procedures, policies and checklists To develop and harmonise trade related SOPs and working instructions with the cluster institutions so to align with SSCP and/or industry best practices, that forms a baseline for accountability and protect against legal, regulatory, and liability issues. To review and update Policies, SOPs and working instructions on a regular basis to ensure relevancy and effectiveness in FM operations. Manage Vendors Performance Meeting contractual requirement / KPI Verification of performance reports & payment arrangement Audits Contact Management Checklist To work closely with Site Lead, Group FM and Contract Management Team in monitoring vendors performance and accounting of key performance indicators (KPIs) as per contract awarded. Verification of performance report, KPIs and invoice To ensure awarded contracts are executed accordingly, and all KPIs and invoices are verified on a monthly basis before payment invoices are endorsed and approved for processing. To ensure repair to reported system fault and breakdown are carried out in a timely manner. To carry out monthly analysis to Mechanical systems breakdown and recommend improvement plan as needed. Audits To conduct systematic audit to assess vendor's overall performance based on planned preventive maintenance schedule. Risk management Contracts Projects (Capex /MOH RR/ Infrastructur al) Audits Critical System failure Work with Contract Management Team, Legal, Finance and MMD to ensure adherence to broader finance and procurement risk requirements such as contract deviations, payment policy and process, pricing, KPI, liquidated damage interest, etc when Mechanical system's contract is to be renewed or procured for. Learning from past MOHH GIA and relevant Audit findings to manage the specialist vendors for their performance and documentation requirements. To provide institution knowledge and Mechanical Trade support (commissioning, review of system design, modifications and interfaces with existing system, etc) proposed in hospital infrastructural projects. To plan and oversee Mechanical system upgrades/improvements or replacements before their expiration or its end of life. To participate and support in audits that the hospital subscribes to. To respond and support the maintenance agent and vendors in mitigating and recovery of critical system failure or incident To lead the investigation of incident/system failure to determine root cause of failure as needed. Knowledge Management Maintain good documentation (e.g. records of all contracts, records, reports, documentation) with the FM Admin Team. To work with Head, Group FM and Site Lead, Group FM to plan for specialty training and develop the capabilities of Mechanical Trade Team members. To participate in Learning from the BEST trips/sessions organised by Group FM and perform sharing of experience and know how as needed. Requirements: Min Degree in any field from a recognized university At least 5 years of relevant work experience in Facilities, Operations Project management experience in setting up medical specialist centre will be an added advantage Strong analytical and readiness in a fast paced environment Possess excellent leadership, strong interpersonal and communication skills Positive with a "can do" attitude If you are interested in any of the positions, do kindly drop your most updated resume to ( Attn: Facilities Management Lead ) Thank You. Job_Descriptions: Front End Tech Lead, 12-month contract to perm About TEKsystems: We're in the business of building tomorrow. It's not about reading the signs and making sure you're ready, it's about deciding where and how you want to get to the next level. At TEKsystems, we're obsessed with technology. Its power to change everything. Technology fuels our passion and commitment to helping organisations do what they set out to. When we engage, we bring fresh ideas that help you galvanise your performance. Refine your strategy. Spark new energy. The future-and how we get there-depends on those who build, connect, create and transform our world. The most successful and innovative businesses are already doing it, and we're skilled experts at bringing the talent they need to thrive. Job Description: The Tech Lead play a critical role responsible for implementing the front-end logic that defines the behavior of the visual elements of a web application. Actively involved throughout the project lifecycle, often times starting with rapid prototypes early in the design phase. We are looking for a Senior Front-end Angular Developer who is passionate about design and programming. Responsibilities include implementing visual elements and their behaviors with user interactions. You will work with both front-end and back-end web developers to build all client-side logic. You will also be bridging the gap between the visual elements and the server-side infrastructure, taking an active role on both sides, and defining how the application looks and functions. Day to day work will not be coding but to provide support to existing teams in terms of: Setting standards Reviewing code Troubleshooting complex bugs Experience Required: Hands-on knowledge of working with angular applications. Demonstrated experience on ability to code an angular app. We will do a coding assessment. Knowledge of end to end tech stack: Front-end, middleware, backend. Front-end analytics experience: User behaviour and activity analytics Site performance and utilization Social media integrations for distribution and marketing AWS experience preferred. For more information you can email Michelle Hoang in our Singapore office on michelle.hoang@teksystems.com quoting Job Reference 527369 or alternatively, apply here to register your interest. http://jobs.en-sg.teksystems.com/HJs8DR/front-end-tech-lead-12-month-contract-to-perm-itcommunications-unknown-singapore-14826477 Allegis Group Singapore Pte Ltd, Company Reg No. 200909448N, EA Licence No. 10C4544

Job_Descriptions: Business Function As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business - they were made just right for you. Job Description Summary Manage and grow a leading hybrid human-robo investment platform in Singapore with focus on platform development, broadening investment options and engaging new and existing clients. This will be performed through: Close collaboration with colleagues across investment teams, technology delivery teams, client experience, marketing, and compliance to deliver impactful investment solutions and platform capabilities to our clients. Conduct user immersion studies and drive the implementation of insights with a focus on developing simple and impactful client journeys. Strategically plan and execute a long-term roadmap with clearly defined delivery milestones to demonstrate progress to key stakeholders. Be accountable for ROI with robust post-delivery tracking. Rely on data and to identify and utilise appropriate levers to drive business KPI growth in acquisition and revenue. Lead ideation and creation of material for client engagement using a wide spectrum of digital channels and media. Candidate requirements Ambition to develop a leading hybrid human-robo investment platform. At least 5 years of working experience in banking and finance. Product Management experience in digital investments would be advantageous. Degree in Finance or Economics with strong business acumen. Good knowledge of stakeholder and project management. Strong analytical skills and comfortable with data. Strong knowledge of major investment products preferred but interest in investing is a must have. Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Job_Descriptions: Senior Associate/AVP, Relationship Manager, Food & Agribusiness, Institutional Banking Group - (WD29730) Business Function Corporate and Investment Banking provides corporate customers with a full range of commercial banking products and services, including cash management services, current accounts, time deposits, trade finance, working capital finance, term loans and foreign exchange. Through our continued commitment, DBS has cultivated long-standing relationships with its customers in the region that are based on account relationship management, service differentiation, product development and rigorous credit standards. Responsibilities Manage and expand a portfolio of corporate clients in the Food & Agribusiness Industry in Singapore and the Bank’s core markets. For clients in core markets outside of Singapore, relationship to be jointly managed with the various geography coverage teams. Create and execute account plans for identified clients in the assigned portfolio to increase share of wallet by offering corporate banking products of the Bank, including capital markets (Debt Capital Markets, Equity Capital Markets and M&A), transaction banking services (Cash and Trade) and treasury. Prepare credit applications (quantitative and qualitative client analysis), credit renewal and undertake periodic review of assigned portfolio Monitor and manage accounts actively, being alert to credit deterioration or improvement, and taking timely action including elevation to senior bankers and credit Handle loan & security documentation and negotiation with good degree of competence Assist in industry related research and strategy exercises such as development of new growth areas, country strategies and industry benchmarking. Requirements Bachelors Degree in related discipline with at least 5 years' relevant experience in corporate and investment banking. Strong credit and financial analytical skills with the ability to independently prepare financial models, cashflow analysis, debt capacity analysis for complex lending structures Must be able to demonstrate good knowledge of corporate bank products. Demonstrate ability to undertake industry level research, with good writing and presentation skills. Experience of working with databases such as Capital IQ and proficiency in MS Excel and Power Point will be an advantage. Team player with strong interpersonal and communication skills CFA degree holders preferred. Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Work as business partners with stakeholders across the Group, and assist the HOD/Senior Audit Manager to better manage business and Technology, Information, Cyber, and Digital risks; and 2.
